ad5V2fCYD4wsET4239h2SQ.text: I love Texas de Brazil. For one, you know EXACTLY what you're going to get. High quality, flavorful, delicious food.   I have been to TDB in the past but this was my first time at this location. The food was equally great, upkeep of the premises, and prices.   My server was not as attentive as I am used to so that's why there's a missing star.   Anyways, if you're even thinking of a churrascaria, look no further! This TDB will not disappoint!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front Entrance
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calm before the storm. You flip to GREEN if you want them to keep coming to your table or RED if you need a break!

uG1R8I6oE3OXnywJA10WTw.text: We came to splurge. We enjoyed the great service and the abundance of food. The services includes unlimited styles of meats. The bar area has side dishes to select from.

-VhUFQsyRGqXbxJm7r2hrg.text: I was in meat heaven!!!! Carnivore through and through!!! Texas de Brazil is one of my favorite places to go.... Amazing side dishes that you can choose from, Brazilian cheese bread that's so addicting! And the best part men coming around to your tables with all types of meat on what are large skewers (looks kinda like a sword) that they slice for you at your table!!! My favorites are the lamb chops and they're specialty top sirloin!!! AHHHMAZING!!!!!   Our server Amanda Newman was wonderful!!! She was so accommodating and friendly to both my friend and I... I give her 10 stars for her EXCELLENT customer service!!! We spoke highly of her to her manager. I always enjoy coming here... Next time we're gonna ask to sit in her section... From the hostesses to our server, and the men serving the meat, I must say that I really enjoyed our dinner tonight!!! I know it says that this was my first time checking in here but I've been here dozens of times... Always a great place to go!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iOyWAJep6nq3HAlS2ovdgA.text: We just got home from dinner, everything was amazing! The salad bar was a great start, a lot of options to choose from. I also was very impressed at how clean and organized it was kept throughout the evening. Our servers name was Fernando and he was fantastic! He stayed on top of our drink refills and always made sure the clutter from the table was removed.  The meat carvers were all so friendly and came around very quickly. The meats ranged from top sirloin, flank steak, chicken, lamb chops and legs, bacon wrapped filet minion and some other varieties.  It was my moms birthday and they gave her a complimentary dessert, they offered creme brulee, carrot cake, chocolate cake, cheesecake, and key lime pie. We opted for the cheesecake for her, they wrote happy birthday on her plate in chocolate and raspberry syrup.  All in all the dinner was wonderful, I would highly recommend Texas de Brazil.

ythYSii4Dgb2KaJKioSZ5w.text: The food is always good here no matter which location you go to.  On our last visit we were with a fairly large group of about 16 people.  They sat us in a small room, which should have been good for a group.  However, it seemed like we were kinda forgotten at the back of the restaurant.  Also, the place is so noisy that I could barely visit with the person sitting next to me.

kcX7gHPyJG-yHmCOG8l6Bg.text: Excellent environment and great food! Lots of selections at the salad bar and servers were personable and accommodating! You will get very full!

K0qeOnTGnlwmZsMvdy3f_Q.text: This is my second time coming to this restaurant and all I can say is that it's amazing. The minute you walk in you can you can tell the ambiance is quite classy and intimate. We walked in right when it opened and we're seated right away, however, it got pretty crowded by the hour so I would recommend to make a reservation.   This Brazilian steakhouse is basically an all you can eat steakhouse so definitely come on an empty stomach! They have servers walking around with a variety of meat and all you have to do is flip your card either green or red side up for the servers; green for go, red for stop. Once the server is at your table, you'll have your meat sliced right in front of you. In addition to this delicious meal, they have a salad bar to balance out the meat. They have variety of food like soup, salad, bread, and vegetables.   Another reason why I gave 5/5 stars is for their service. Our server gave an brief description of what we were about to get into and from time to time he would constantly ask if there is anything we need. Another pointer is that all of the servers would fold your napkin back into its original position so it's all nice and tidy when you come back to your table.   Last but not least, all of their soft drinks, coffee, and desserts are included in your meal. Desserts are limited 1 per person but they have a wide range to choose from, from a slice of cake to a cup of creme brulee. Nothing could have ended a filling meal other than a sweet dessert.

4j-1nSRDuwVk_1cMx1sjcA.text: Absolutely love this place great service, delicious variety and nice lighting. Seating is a bit tight but comfortable. For the business they do and how busy they are the restrooms tables and staff always look great.

rw3vAB8YcOHyVM9gq2gVDg.text: This is, hands down, my FAVORITE place to eat in Vegas.  I used to eat here at least twice a month. It's ALWAYS busy every time I go. However, week nights are not as busy compared to weekends. Make sure you call to reserve a table ahead of time! Or you can go online to make reservations.  In the salad bar, my favorites are the cucumber/onion salad and the au gratin potatoes. Tip: don't fill up on the salad bar if you plan on trying/eating a lot of the meats!  The servers bring each table a basket of cheese bread, mashed potatoes, and caramelized bananas. The cheese bread is good. So good, in fact, that my boyfriend wanted to go here JUST to fill up on the cheese bread. The potatoes were good as well, but it doesn't beat the au gratin potatoes that are offered at the salad bar. And the bananas are to be eaten in between meats because it's said to clear the taste pallet, so you're not mixing the tastes of the meats. But I just eat them up because they're really tasty.  There are a variety of meats (beef, lamb, pork, chicken, sausage, etc) and it's easy to get overwhelmed when you get offered half a dozen meats in a matter of minutes. My favorite will always be the house special: the picahna. It has some fat around the edges, which is my favorite part because it's PACKED with flavor. I always ask if they can cut multiple slices for me.  If you actually have room for dessert, I recommend the creme brulee. It's easily the BEST creme brulee I've ever had in my life.  My favorite part about Texas de Brazil is that the servers come around the tables and ask if there's a specific meat request you have. Within a few minutes, you'll have someone with that meat right at your table.   It is about $50 a person, but it is definitely worth every penny for the amount you eat, all the delicious flavors you experience, and the amazing service you receive.

4qOzy0YU0jRNstbpE3SYjA.text: Food was good but when you flip the card they were bringing it non stop. Fill up the plates too quickly. Also did not have time to enjoy your meat. Server was good also. I would not go back

4mfPXx6YhFiU9-3_MBrYjg.text: Had an amazing lunch, the meat cooked perfect including lamb. I hope next time they have chicken hearts as well!

m_NvbJw2NZJj4n-vZKYqvw.text: We went on Monday, 10/8 for my brother's birthday lunch. This is my 4th time there and never had a bad experience. Just realized I've only gone there for birthday celebrations, but the food and service has always been excellent! Our server was Ashleigh. She was awesome from start to finish. She checked in on us frequently and reminded us of others things throughout our meal with being bothersome. The gauchos were all equally friendly and attentive as well. Whenever we needed a breather, just turn your card over so they don't come with more meat. Pace yourselves.   All the meat choices were seasoned well, very tasty and fresh and hot out of the kitchen.  My brother was treated to a complimentary dessert. He chose the chocolate decadence cake (which is the bomb) and my husband had cream brulee, also yummy.  Note: Please make a reservation online. It's fast and easy! Nothing's worse than going to a restaurant and waiting an hour or more for a table to open up.  Also, Monday was Texas de Brazil's 20th anniversary! Cheers!  Well, I'm returning to Vegas in about 4 weeks. You'll know where to find me! Happy eating!

Taiexn-wgGSq_bYFQOuybA.text: This is definitely one of my new favorite spots! I had never been to a Brazilian steakhouse before, so I was excited at the chance to check this place out. We got there before they opened, but they still let us come inside and wait in the A/C until they were ready to go. There were a lot of people waiting to be seated, but we still got to our table quickly and our servers were very patient and friendly as we waited for the rest of our group to get there. One of them offered us some recommendations on the drink menu, and educated us about some of the food items we would be offered as well. Once everyone arrived, we walked over to the salad bar which had a ton of great options! There were many different vegetables, soups, salads, and other sides. Among the options, some of the things I chose were lobster bisque, asparagus, mushroom salad, roasted peppers, shrimp, smoked salmon, quinoa and squash. I got very small samples of the sides, knowing that there was still a lot of food to come. After we sat back down at the table, we were told to flip our cards over to green whenever we were ready for the different meats. Once you do that, there is a parade of large skewers being brought around by various servers that have some of the best steak, chicken, and pork that you'll ever find in one place! I had bacon wrapped filet, top sirloin, tenderloin, and garlic steak. Every single one was so flavorful and tender. What I also love, is that they bring different steak temperatures around and ask you if you'd like that, or let you know that they'll be bringing around one that is your preferred temperature soon. If they only have something in medium rare, for example, you can also request that it be cooked longer. There were some of the meats that we really enjoyed at our table, and when we asked for extra slices or larger portions, our server did not hold back! He was very generous and happy to come back frequently to bring anything we needed. We got so much food, and it was definitely worth the price! I will be back here for sure.

tKfRs92O3ID0MytbbrKYkQ.text: Yes, the food is five stars and yes the service was five star. This is one of the best things about Vegas. Never ending places to eat. This diner and her husband did enjoy eating here. Super staff and wonderful service from front to back. We will be back.

1vH8FULgApS4vmv1BOC0VA.text: First time and we were so disappointed with the service and most specifically with the hostess and manager. We came in with a reservation and step in 8 mins before our reserved time. The hostess said to wait 10 mins as they are cleaning up. So we had to wait and 10 mins had past and followed up again, then she blatantly said to wait another 10 mins without even apologizing for the wait. I do get that they are extremely busy and thats why we had reservations. It's bot unlike other places of they foresee you are to wait they will at least inform you of the hang up. Last follow up we mad its already 20 mins past our reservation and this time, it's the manager who is standing in the reception, just said" table is getting ready" for a manager to be like that and seems he don't care. We are first timers with the hopes of coming back so we have options other than Fogo but with this experience, i don't think we are and definitely not recommending this loud and noisy place for a nice dinner...  Food as okay, I gave 1 star for plenty of choices for hot dishes and salad but thats about it!!!

_VjdgyVy2zSH0TNJHElEfA.text: The food is amazing and worth every price. Adam as a server gives great service and is very knowledgeable. He made it more enjoyable by bringing every meat we wanted fresh! Definitely a great spot if you want some good steak!

Fl_SV-uAp66wwsYWByap8Q.text: Food was really good! Good service! Just wish they had the grilled pineapple like other Brazilian steakhouses. If they have that it's a staple on a good experience.

1MxreLJsVGmfTtqJL_lkMg.text: Never disappoints. Their lobster bisque is delicious and their meats are to die for! Never had trouble getting of my favorites because the servers are always coming around to offer you their wide selection.

They are usually busy to make your reservations. They're open for lunch too. If you want never ending meats, I recommend this. :D

qbif50C6Ogj6zeqoX9171A.text: I thought there was maybe a catch when I read that Texas de Brazil were offering free dinners for Veterans on 11-12 Nov. 2NSfkbbNMi7RofZ8sEy8iA.text: Great service! Variety of different steaks, chicken, lamb chops, sausage and a buffet of sides. The taste and season one are the best. Come on an empty stomach and be prepared to eat all you can because it is very filling. Love this place and I always come him occasionally.

99dMzC8dUlKvBzdpd9xkmw.text: We absolutely LOVED this restaurant! The ambiance is great, everyone was friendly and the food was AMAZING! Best salad bar ever. Our server David was fantastic, extremely knowledgeable and didn't rush is even though we said we we're full. We definitely recommend it. For meat lovers. BRING YOUR APPETITE!

K3NEyiYTabqSmXaXkC6-kg.text: Went for my birthday dinner.  First time there.  It was fantastic.  The food and service were wonderful.   Would go everyday if I could.  Now I just have to figure out how to have more than 1 birthday in a year

qEfjt6q7Tr6sCG9RmT5dtQ.text: Amazing food and great staff, I enjoyed dinner with my husband for his birthday and it was beyond my expectations. The waiter was sweet and very attentive and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend this place for any meat lovers out there trying to get their money's worth.

-9B9CO9-v1UgcglzGFLuCw.text: Texas de Brazil never disappoints my wife and I. We enjoy this place very much. All in all the servers are awesome. Kaylee S was our server for the night and she is great. Top notch, very attentive , sneaky as well finding out what we were here for. My wife and I were celebrating our Anniversary. We ordered a desert and she made sure It showed "Happy Anniversary" on the plate. I'm pretty sure they do it for everyone but still finding out what we were there for is amazing. Little things do matter and it's what make memories. And it also makes us come back every time.

9NNpzjp4bRQhnYlXSaLUpg.text: I had reservations for 5:30 but arrived a little earlier. The hostess was still able to seat my party of four within no time. Our waiter was very attentive and paid attention to all of our needs. She recommend the red sangria to my girlfriend and I and it was delicious! The food was very well perhaps there should be a separate card for guest who do not eat pork. Just a recommendation, I love pork! lol The lights were kind of dim which made the experience more intimate than most Brazilian Steakhouse. We did not have dessert but the plastic immitations looked really appetizing to me. I thought it was real My girlfriend and her date did have two lattes. That were enjoyable as well.  Definitely will come back!

JU6GPPkw-o45PnfqZCp20g.text: Meat lovers paradise! Great flavor, service and ambiance. We love Peter! His service is superb! House sirlion is on point! From the moment we walk in the hostess are professional and seat us in a timely matter with lots of smiles. Management is always aware of whats going on. Any request made is a priority. Forget any fine dining restaraunt, just come here! Hands down the very best churrascaria in Vegas!

7xFjkVWUlkuNJQocHRwPHA.text: The food and buffet was great. Wise there were a few more chicken options with less pork, but the beef options were amazing and tasty!

ahacZu72EPz31C8IXdSExA.text: 8/17/2017 updated review  I came in tonight at 630 with a reservation. We were greeted promptly upon arrival by a hostess that I remember from my last visit. she's very nice and polite. Although the girl who seated us was lacking personality. Our server on the other hand was amazing! He made sure everything came to our table so my guests could sample everything I raved about! Their favorite was the garlic sirloin! I agree that's my favorite too! Definitely suggest making reservation because I heard them quoting 1 hour wait for no reservation. I'm glad I made mine! Will definitely come back again again again!   I came in today for lunch 1/4/17. All you can eat for $32.99! I came in with a party of 3,immediately we were greeted by the sweetest hostess! She gave us an awesome piece of advice to not go over board at the salad area and save room for the meats! She was right! Although, they have an amazing salad bar with everything you can imagine, the meats are the star of the show! Our server was extremely attentive to our needs, she made sure we really enjoyed our experience. We were on or lunch break so we didn't stay for long but I'll definitely be back for dinner! Amazing staff, amazing food!

7zryhbEsOgZqtgpV1VK67g.text: No I'm sorry I won't be back!! For the amount of money we spend at the place in one visit with a party of 10 or more always. With drinks and dessert you could one time make an exception. Greed is a disgusting trait!!  Keep your Texas de Brazil.

_jtO13crj4kYJan2xI35TQ.text: This place was great! I'm not much for meat but the meat here was tender and tasteful. Their salad bar had a great variety of side to accompany your meats. I would definitely come back here. The place was pretty busy for a Monday night. The lighting was decent and focused on the food. This place is very pricey though. If you like soda, they charge per bottle. Service was ok. Drinks from the bar were ok.

mS-sT3P3gF8zgxRLOMYw5w.text: A terrible experience!  We have been there many times to celebrate friends birthdays ( usually 3 times a year with a party of 10 to 12 guests....but this night everything was off. Four times they did not have our wine selection.One of the glasses had some strange cystalization of sugar or something at the bottom of two of our glasses...then when they found a bottle they could serve us we couldn't even taste it before buying it.We didn't even get our first glass untill half way through our dinner. The rounds of meats were not coming to our table except the chicken that came 5 times.. and we kept having to ask for our waters to be refilled. I don't think we will be returning.....

g0yaxsBpfE5-usc_vkxa3Q.text: Amazing! If you enjoy fine meats and great service, make sure you try this wonderful SteakHouse. It not in the strip either. It's located in a quiet place near Flemings Steak House. My husband in fact said, " Babe, are you sure you don't want to go to Flemings? " I replied, "No babe, I'd like to try something new" and it was! My husband later said, " I'm so glad you didn't cave in when I brought up Flemings! This place was AWESOME! So I am now 12 for 12 with the places I have found and enjoyed. Eat healthy and happy everyone!

YEqvVoseyq9jGGLtkK0KGg.text: The "salad" bar is a meal unto itself.  Everything on it was fresh and delicious and an amazing variety of choices.  The meats were good, altho I must say that after the salad bar, I really didn't eat much of the meat, altho what I had was very good.  If and when I return, I think I'll just have the salad bar.  Our server, Peter,  made the evening, however.  He was friendly, efficient, smiled, and made it seemed like he really enjoyed taking care of us.  The place was packed, and yet we were seated at our arrival time, and while dinner was leisurely, we never felt ignored.  There were ten of us at our table, and everyone loved the evening!

c57Ikbh9fh9uHYpSbVHvlA.text: We ate here over the weekend. My wife and our friends have a tradition of eating Brazilian grill when we get together.   Let's start by going in there buffet bar. It was exquisite with fresh and premium choices of hoer derves, charcuterie, salad, and lobster bisque. They give you cheese balls, there version of plantain bananas to clear your pallet when trying new meats, and mash potatoes on your table.   I always eat light on the buffet because I pay for the meats. I thought their cuts of meat where marinated splendidly. I saw and ate at least a dozen cuts of meat, and I am sure there were more. My favorite was beef ribs, the most moist cut there and it melts in your mouth like butter. You can request for meats and they will bring it to your table. The meats will keep on coming as long as your tab on your table is green.   Overall eating here is fantastic experience from the service to the food and to the environment it is worth price. Lastly, the customer service here is amazing so make sure you tip your servers well. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a great Brazilian grill experience.

0SDc5m9oLeuHmTVUCbFTDA.text: This place is AMAZING! We usually go to the one in Miami so whenever we make our way to Vegas (from California), it's a must. The food is delicious!! Tons of things to choose from the buffet and the choice is meats are to die for.  Yum! Can't wait to come back!

T6c-NuirGR7pWgLiBUHlWQ.text: Me and my Husband Love this place, today was one of the best night at Texas, we had a reservation at 6:00 today, Alejandro I think was his name, Was our server, what a kind, professional and polite person, everything delicious as always, but the service today was more than amazing thanks to Him.

2DOlU0PmBa5_AAkiKDuJYA.text: Came here on a Saturday for lunch. $50/person which includes a soft drink and slice of dessert!  Meat quality is good, cooked well for the most part. Comes with sides of plantains and mashed potatoes.   Plantains were eh, sugar crystally coat over the plantains.  Salad - pretty good items. Grilled garlic...mmmmm Lobster bisque was a little salty Cheese bread - okay. Nothing spectacular. I still love Fogo de Chaos cheese bread (popovers) a lot more  Dessert - pretty good too

Oyr866R34z4vkatDkGSctQ.text: One of my favorites, always so good! I hate the wait though and it's nearly impossible to go without a reservation

MPEXMp-FOlqvRxa4Dd47TQ.text: They have a really good salad bar. I'm not too crazy about their meats. Their ribs are pretty good. The service could definitely be better. I gave it 3 stars because of the salad bar.

NllDH1DCdYXjSjfkuh2wNg.text: Walked in. Told one hour wait. Put our names down. One hour later told another 45 minutes. Really? No thanks.

nInjfFk0f64PeCasjgXZAw.text: Get Crystal a raise, she did a great job serving me and my fiancee, I asked her to bring sausages my way and she got one to me the next minute. Great smile from her and she never missed a beat.

55ANSBHTXlnPOSbw45BZYg.text: O.M.G!!I was kinda hesitant to eat here because it was so pricey.... but, i loooove food and it was sooo worth it! My gosh, what can I say everything was so damn delicious!! And I mean EVERYTHING! Staff is very nice and friendly comfortable and beautiful atmosphere. I only gave 4 stars because I'm not a big fan of rare/red meat. You can order it how you want it but I didn't want to wait and I was just too busy enjoying everything else so I didn't mind.

kwau4jBW18upLGpBtAv-zA.text: This place is definitely a unique dining experience. For those of you who don't know, you usually start off with getting a plate from the salad bar and selecting various side dishes, which are usually pretty good and vary sometimes. The only thing I do not enjoy from this place is their shrimp, and it's bad enough to take a star away. For whatever reason, their shrimp always make me feel queasy and then afterwards I have an aversion to shrimp for a few months. Not sure what's up with that as I love shrimp. The rest of the stuff in the salad/side dish bar are pretty good. Just don't fill up on this part, because the meats are what you're really paying the big bucks for.....  Once you return to your table, you'll be approached by waiters carrying around big skewers of different sorts of meats, which you personally will select, or pass up. There is no shortage of delicious meats, trust me! The meats are almost all delicious, and their desserts are divine. It's overall a fun and unique dining experience. The wait staff is always professional and attentive, despite how packed this place usually is. Fix the shrimp, and I'll give them five stars. :) Hubby and I like to get gift cards to this place for date night because it's fun and fantastic.

tPP6YmwykbyjIqUt5CqvsA.text: So this is my third time here. Finally decided to write a review. We went for the promotional roll back pricing. I suppose for that price is was alright. You can't use their white gift cards on discounts such as this, which really sucks. They claim because the white cards are already discounted. I got my card from work, so I wasn't aware it was a discounted card.  The food was plentiful. The salad bar was consistently re-stocked and clean. Many of the meats weren't warm. I suppose it was because it's was super busy and we were seated pretty far away. We had three people helping us, and it wasn't clear who the waiter was till we were halfway done eating. I ordered a coke right when we sat down, but it never came and I had to order again. This particular visit it was also annoying that the meat guys stopped even when the red side was up on our marker. I mean what's the point of that if they ignore it. All in all, our waiter, when we finally knew who he was, was good. But he was really busy and it showed.

JOKWhqARX6FLZas2GPWfaQ.text: We've been coming here for a few years or so now. I am a carnivore and a half, so churrascaria is right up my alley. My card stays green until I tap out because although I love the options, I am particular to the ones I eat. I especially love, LOVE, love the special house sirloin.   On the regular, I am not a sirloin kindza girl... but here, omg!! It's a must!! The charred trim of fat is just a burst of flavors to accompany the tender meat party in my mouth. My second favorite meat is I believe the flank steak. It is so tender and juicy. I rarely try the other meats TBH lol. As far as the salad bar, I usually fux with everything there, but at Texas De Brazil, it's hard for me to eat too much of it because then I'll get full too fast lol. I do love the mushrooms to accompany my steaks, grilled pineapples, and lobster bisque.   We also enjoy the plantains and cheese rolls that come out. The mashed potatoes are good too. Service has been nothing but great thus far. Wine options are very broad. There's definitely something to pair with all the meats served here. I usually go for a CabSauv to satiate my palate when I am eating the meats here.   You bet we are coming back for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X5HjlwVHZAcObIhPM71Enw.text: Come Once A Year From California To Celebrate My Anniversary, They Always Take Very Good Care Of Us Great Food Great Service :)

P0vFGKrGcpWE2qaNJTGhYQ.text: Texas de Brazil found their way to my stomach and therefore have found their way into my heart. I don't know why we didn't try this place sooner!  First of all, this Texas de Brazil is in a prime location: inside Town Square and minutes from the airport as well as the Strip. After a long day of shopping and/or taking in the sights, this would be a perfect option for dinner.   The process is simple. You're given a small double sided card. Green means go and red means stop. There are many different servers throughout the restaurant that will bring you many different varieties of meat. There's an unlimited salad bar so you can have sides with your meat. You're also given a side of mashed potatoes. They also give you a side of plantains that serves as a palate cleanser in between meats, but they are also a perfect sweet snack to have after your meal.  The service was wonderful and the atmosphere was exciting. The food was delicious and the meats were all cooked to perfection. It's clear that these guys are pros in their game. The only downside is the hefty price tag, but it's worth every penny in my opinion.   If you love meat or are looking for a unique take on a steak house, please do me a favor and try this place out. I will be back and I will be finding any reason to make up a special occasion to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brulee
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

iR1IuiwyE3KxTxz2-oML-w.text: I have been visiting here for over 5+ years now and every visit has consistently been a treat.  Here's my summary of all those great visits throughout the years. My last visit was on a Thursday night with a 7:45 reservation dinner for 3.  Service: Amazing how consistent the service has been considering it's always packed at just about every visit. They get you started quickly with the bread, garlic mashed potatoes and fried sweet bananas within 7 minutes of sitting down.  Waters are filled, drink orders are taken and you're off.  You don't have to worry about  Food: Consistently on point!  Salad Bar: The creamy lobster bisque, doesn't actually have lobster in it.  BUT I love it, I start each visit with the bisque and end it with the bisque when I'm full af. Yes, that's weird.  Slabs of goat cheese, jalapenos and asparagus tips is what I throw down with the meats.  It amazes me how everything here is always high quality and fresh.  Meats: The presentation of the waiters bringing around the slabs of meat is always fun to me, like Disneyland.  Some meats have better days than others, but these are my favs. Filet Mignon - Medium rare is the only way I roll. House Sirloin - Usually get this 3 times if they have it. Lamb Chops - Lamb can be messed up quickly if not prepared right, always good here. Pork Ribs - Always juicy, with too much fat sometimes.  Which I actually like, ugh. lol Flank Steak - Seems to always be the first meat on the plate? I don't mind Parmesan Crusted Pork Loin - If not careful, this can come out dry. But so good when it's not!  Value: $49.99 (dinner) for AYCE meat brings me pretty good value imo.  Coupled with the amazing salad bar, totally gets us home.  Ambiance: High quality utensils and plates are utilized as you're cutting meat all day.  Tables, are packed tight but not to hinder travel throughout the restaurant.  It's going to be noisy because it's always packed but still a great place for a date to have conversation.  Classy atmosphere that puts you in a good mood to eat massively =)  Summary: I usually save this place to bring visiting guests who don't have a texas de brazil or haven't experienced this type of dining.  At the same time, it's great place to just get down when you're looking to get your alpha carnivore on.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. medium rare..don&#39;t care...
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops, I get happy when I see this come around
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggies + cheese + meat + cheese

djP4LWyEfM0NRxVUXDaw1Q.text: Came here again on thanksgiving. Glad the pricing was not inflated for the holidays. Quality of meat was excellent as usual

RZrhANNLrLwFh0Zg5nAnLw.text: Very disappointed here today.  Service is poor. Sitting for over 30 minutes... still no drinks. Meat servers are walking by our table... not stopping.. very sad. Plates are empty as the servers just walk by....This is usually a wonderful experience here. Not today. All the meat was bloody red and almost raw... it was not good; then you ask for meat to be medium or medium well and then u sit some more.  We actually said something to the mgr; it's supposed to be a dining experience.... they are supposed to make it an unforgettable experience. It's unfortunately unforgettable, but in a bad way. We will not be going back for a long while, it's a lot of money to waste on a shitty experience.

QGyrnEXPntCLoxbYUI4pQw.text: Always delicious and excellent service. One of my favorite spots. Make a reservation if your going for dinner on a weekend.

AWnN7p2ylb6tkXURsQ9q_g.text: After being recommended by my friends, we decided to go to Texas de Brazil to see if it lives up to its reputation.  They are located in Town Square on the sunset road side in its own building.  We got there about 8:30 pm and the restaurant was kinda packed but they found seating in no time.  For about $50 dollars per person you get all you can eat meats served to your table and a salad bar.  The concept sounds better than it actually is.  In the 1-1/2 hours we were there, we were unable to sample all meats because the servers did not come to our table despite the disk being green side up (green side up means you want the servers to come).  When we asked the waiter about sampling all the meats he seemed to think we were being unreasonable saying just to pick one or two meats.  The meats that did come to our table were mostly repeats as there were 5 different guys serving the sirloin (the cheap cut).  The more popular meats such as braised beef ribs and barbecued pork ribs needed to be ordered through the waiter.  Most of the meats were overcooked, dry and some burnt.  When the meat gets cold they take it back to the kitchen to be reheated.  You can tell because some of the meats that came to our table had flat cut marks all over the meat and the outer edge was seared.  Finally, with all the people coughing from the dry/cold weather, I really didn't like how they would walk around the restaurant with the meats.  It just seemed unsanitary.  That said, the braised beef ribs were good although being overcooked and the salad bar was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-tG_8Ygjk0wtliSsGF9A1A.text: Use the AT&T thank you app for 25$ discount for 2 having dinner Monday - Thurday.  We enjoyed our dinner but in comparison to FDC - I would say its close but not the same.  Price is competitive and so is the service but some of the meats are dry and but my favorites were the sausage, beef picahna, cheese balls, filet mignon, and lobster bisque.  Everything else was ok but not notable.  Salad bar was weak as well but we were there for the meats so it was not as much of let down.  Would try again.

aV5tXZ-BTaETG-48Bt-tZQ.text: What can you say about Texas de Brazil that hasn't been said? It is the crown jewel and best known name in Brazilian steakhouses. If you know this place is coming, do avoid eating anything too large during the day. The salad bar has great gems but we all know it's there to get you full.   If you call ahead for corporate events they have great rooms to fit a very large number of staff.

2JxeUeAJ2IusDhgDkSlzrw.text: Texas de Brazil got the best on overall. The Service, the place, the food and the dessert. Quality meat. The service, Love it! Very well trained and mannered. The lamb chops bruh! You gotta try it!   They also have the lobster soup and the cinnamon banana. This is my spot in LA and Las Vegas. If you go to SF tho I know a place but let's just stick to Texas de brazil!

94s101iuFpOyTlhXKAyMUw.text: This restaurant is near a lot of shops in Town Square, so understandably, this place gets crowded very fast, especially during the evening and weekends. I definitely recommend calling for an RSVP in advance! The food was amazing! Their meats are all cooked at a rare to medium scale, but if that isn't your preference, you can request any of their meat selections up to well done. All their rare meats were very tender and full of flavor so I also recommend trying them rare! The salad bar had a great selection of sides as well as soups. Our server was very friendly and easy to talk to and explained how the Brazilian Steakhouse red/green cards work with ease. I decided to return again a couple weeks later to treat my dad for his birthday and he had a great time (and wants me to take him again lol)! I would absolutely come back again! Thanks for the superb service!

YUwEJzLXnE6mAXtghG3HzA.text: We have been to this location 5+ times and the service, food, and  atmosphere is always great!!!  On Saturday May 4th we were in town to celebrate our son's 21st with a group of friends and family and everything was great!   Our service was outstanding if you can ask for Litany's area. She has taken care of us before and it's always great!!!   Thanks for a great evening!!!

9D9jhTbDLSTL9Q6aU6PCrQ.text: Been here 4x in the last 2 months and every time, it's amazing! My favorite is the Picanha! Also the filet mignon, and the plantains in between. They also offer 20% off for nurses so that's a plus. This is my top Churrascaria in LV!

wIZQhXjczHwI1Fqzzw8ANg.text: I give it to the gentleman working the bar the evening we came. If it weren't for him, we'd probably have had a terrible time.   Located in the town square plaza with shopping centers.   We walked in and asked about the menu and if there were a la carte options or plain all you can eat/salad bar. The lady was rude and kept reiterating it was all you can eat and I was like I get it, but are there a la carte options in case an individual wasn't in the mood to stuff his or her face?! It ticked me off the nerve she had.   We resorted to the bar area, which is cute and dainty with lounge tables that can seat 2-4 people or the bar top of course.   We only had a few drinks, in which the gentleman (I wish we got his name) recommended and what their known for. I couldn't believe how fresh and delicious they were!   We didn't eat here, it was already 9pm and we decided not to be left with the leftovers of the evening and left on our way. But we had a great time chatting with him and enjoyed amazingly refreshing drinks. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The passion fruit option and the lime option

Ka0JeBxMxcm1S3vzJ_nzJg.text: Celebrated my son's birthday with family and the service was incredible!  The meats are delusions! Tasty side dishes and desserts too!  Had to pace ourselves. Our eyes were bigger than our belly.  I recommend this place for celebrations or just a great steak and much mire dinner on the town.  Drinks were made to our desire.  Overall great customer service and very well prepared cuts of meats.  Love it!! Hope you do too !

oV8A-nU3EVRu8MszBPnDSQ.text: Wow for my bachelor party my groomsmen took me out to dinner and we went to Texas de Brazil. This restaurant was amazing. The meat they serve here is top notch. From the sausage to the beef to the lamb it was all delicious. I love lamb pops and almost want to steal the sword with all of them on there. The pre buffet is really good too my friend will rave about the lobster bisque soup all day but with many options everything is worth it. I just saw they have a location near me in Irvine CA so guess one day I'll be going there over and over.

kYgRQHFJqiea40mT8QdxAg.text: I spent my anniversary here with my boyfriend and my experience was amazing. We had reservations at 1900 and when we met with the hostess she said, "That we would be seated momentarily". We literally had to wait for like 4 minutes and they called us to be seated. It was pretty quick! After we were sat down our waitress unfolded our napkins on our lap. Then we had this guy who explained how the whole process works with the green/red card to bring out the meats, the salad/soup bar, etc.   It was our first time eating there and we had a blast. Thank you for making our anniversary a memorable one!

BiPPoCvY7_nqD4awEgQEdw.text: I came here a couple weeks ago and I had the best experience Ive ever had. I'm a regular and come maybe once every a month to every couple months. This time I had a new server name Lan. She gave amazing service and was very attentive to my every need! In all the years I been coming here Lans service was the best.  This review is long over due and everything is amazing great but after the service I had from Lan I had to make sure to write the review.

yA0AAH3Row72qifG4oNCvw.text: Great service and even better food! Every time I come here I end up scarfing down tons of the side dishes and really only have a small amount of the delicious carved meats this place serves up! They had a new coffee crusted pork loin that was perfectly charred and melted in my mouth. The spicy shrimp that was on the bar was also one of my favorite side diahes. I was lucky enough to come on lobster bisque night! Had 3 bowls of it like a boss! Also it was my wife's Bday and they brought her a complimentary cheese cake with a candle and happy birthday in chocolate written on the plate. Think I'm gonna make it mandatory to celebrate every secular holiday here instead of cooking!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wife&#39;s Bday cheese cake complimentary

Y--LlJRfhQ8Z1IAv3F_Wuw.text: We came here last night for dinner. We had reservations so we were able to get seated when at least half of our party arrived. The restaurant was packed!  If you haven't had Brazilian steakhouses before, this is an all you can eat type. You have a paper circle...green for bring me the meat! Red for please stop, I have the meat sweats.   The salad bar had a lot of options so it's hard to not stack up on that. You want to try everything but you also want to save room for all the meats.   They also bring you fried bananas, mashed potatoes, and cheese rolls. Fried bananas were amazing!!! Not like what we have had before. It's not rolled in dough, more so covered in sugar. We got multiple dishes of it. Lobster bisque from the salad bar was a standout as well. Not too heavy on the seafood smell and very buttery.   LOTS OF MEAT! The second you turned that circle green, it was a bit overwhelming with how fast they come at you and ask you if you want certain cuts. If they didn't bring something you wanted or you missed them, you can always requests for the cut. Standouts for meat would be the sausage and the filet. All of the meat was well marinated and incredibly tender.   Great place! Be prepared to eat a lot. We would be back for special occasions but not an every month type of place for us.

RksbjYLhe3GnUlQhNxFwIw.text: Meats are always fresh and delicious.And their salad buffet is amazing also.Servers are kind and good thing is all you can eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N_oXyza4tygSLqEQcJchfw.text: Vance was an amazing server.. Came for my father in law birthday.. 10 people was with our party he made sure everybody got the type of meat the wanted very friendly and courteous

5hLEBcQpwYhBBXhr_Zpg1A.text: Excellent! Green means go! Food was perfectly cooked! Garlic sirloin and the filet were standouts! As is the case with most Brazilian steakhouses, soft drinks are at a minimum and pricey. Full bar though and water is free! Other complaint is the sausage man didn't come around often enough LOL! Been here a few times and every time is excellent! Best Brazilian steakhouse in Vegas!

VpPFi2cCWxRwRuiiOORZEw.text: We had reservations at 7:45pm.. Here's 8:01pm and we are still waiting to be seated. What's the point on making a reservation when you have to wait to be called while the whole time I see people that came in after us and have been seated before us. Disappointing. This is why we like to go to Via Brasil better. We only came here because we have friends in town from Reno. Way to go on putting on a first impression. Customer service is not the greatest at the front.   I will update after dinner with service.  I give the waiter and people who come around with the meats a solid 5 stars but the hostess' a 1... They're just terrible with keeping their reservations.

-JwBZm2UtG5wKOvddr9ALA.text: We have come here a number of times, it is our go to restaurant when we want meat, meat, meat! The garlic filet mignon is delicious and the picana is very tender. There's a wide variety of wines, spirits, cocktails, liquors, etc. (the house wine is very good). Don't fill up with salad here, enjoy the meat! And also enjoy the caramelized bananas they give you at the end, they are so yumi! We always walk-in but roll-out :)

IXA9fKaBd0HGd05PyDCn3w.text: Service is really good. Only waited about 15 minutes for reservations. I feel like it's extremely over priced for the quality of the food. The main item I remember was the salad and how amazing the ranch was. For a steak and meat place that's not a good thing. Overall ok experience

6PFhQq5_tsRS6aLBiLgvMw.text: Excellent service, excellent food! Don't pass on the salad bar! It's amazing! Totally enjoyable dining experience. Without a doubt, we'll go back.

stOo1l2jfYJHiHiIw3Z_7Q.text: Before my favorite churrascaria opened, I used to go here. Although it's cheaper here and they're open for lunch everyday and they have goat cheese at the salad bar, the service and food quality is marginal.   They have the usual Brazilian BBQ salad bar items such as smoked salmon, lettuce, tomatoes, mushrooms, asparagus, cheeses, olives, salami, beans and rice etc. They give you pao de queijo, fried bananas and mashed potatoes. The meats include chicken, beef, pork, sausage and lamb. I've tried their Key Lime pie, cheesecake, flan and chocolate mousse all of which were just ok.  The gaucho guys seem to take longer going around and when I come to a churrascaria, I come famished...waiting cannot happen. They seem careless too. I'd have blood/ oil/ meat juice drip next to my plate or my arm! Obrigadinha!  Out of the churrascaria's in Vegas. FdC on Flamingo is #1 on my list, TdB is #2, VB in Summerlin is #3...and that P place in Planet Hollywood? Forget it!

OO6PVj_VzdqHHvv24XAqMA.text: We've been to Fogo de Chao and wanted to try a different place, so we came here for our first dinner in Vegas. This place was outstanding. Service was impeccable, and from the minute we sat down, meat was coming at us. All of it was a perfect medium rate, all of it perfectly seasoned. I love at these types of places how the servers learn to know what you like and what you don't, so that's what they bring around for you.   We didn't try the salad bar because, well, why would we? . I'm there for MEAT!!!!  We did, however, leave room for dessert. We selected a beautiful citrus vanilla Creme brulee. Oh my...it was heaven. Definitely will visit again. We will at least try the one that's about 1 1/2 hours from our home.   Excellent. Come hungry and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citrus vanilla Creme brûlée. Yum!

uvJYenHGEJ9mMGt3WdPQJA.text: ***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 74/100***  No better way to celebrate a birthday than stuffing yourself silly with mouth watering meats and everything in between. TDB is a carnivore's paradise, from filet mignon to flank steak to lamb chops and leg of lamb the list goes on and on but I have to say the top sirloin steak is my favorite. The salad bar and sides alone are worth coming for but of course the meats are the stars of the show. There's nothing much to add to what's already been uttered again and again about this place being good, it's one of those places you just have to try for yourself at least once.   For me personally, I never get my moneys worth at AYCE places so for next time, Friday lunch (they're only open Fri-Sun for lunch) at about $33 would probably be my best bet. According to our server Adam (who by the way was awesome!!!) There's only a few item difference in the salad bar area between lunch and dinner, but as far as the meat goes it's the same line up. Food, ambiance and service was all on point which makes it a 5 star experience.

G9pj40HDsWEjVjF8ByrOfA.text: This is the first time I have been here for Sunday brunch the only difference from dinner is that you get a dessert and non alcoholic drinks come with your meal. My friend had a VIP card so unfortunately she didn't qualify for the freebies since she would be getting a discount with her card. The salad bar is packed with tasty sides to go with your meal. My favorites are the grilled pineapple , shrimp, quinoa, potato salad, tabbouleh, lobster bisque, and marinated mushrooms. I'll usually pair the pineapple with the shrimp so I can get the sweet and savory taste. They also place these fresh tiny pieces of bread that taste like cheez its on the table. If you have never been to a Brazilian barbecue it is equal to a meat bonanza! (All you can eat) There are little place cards on the table when you want meat brought to the table flip the green side up when you have to much to handle flip it back to red. They come around with chicken wrapped in bacon, sausage, filet mignon, garlic flavored steak, flank steak etc. I was so full I didn't care if we missed out on the free dessert! It's a great place to go if you want a new dining experience and are tired of paying $25.00 for itty bitty pieces of steak!

5ZLje7tQoSRB6AP50omnEQ.text: I will give 5 stars: good location, nice and gentle stuff.  Enough room inside. Have been here with my family, everyone happy. Expensive but it worth it. KVMn8KfmArh0jqZilm_DFg.text: Great service from Roberto today. Very attentive and polite. He made sure we had everything we needed from when we first arrived all the way to when we were done with our dinner.

qZ4DPdpezVEpVFq2wT0crA.text: Love this place. Love the lobster soup.  Great atmosphere. Nice staff. I liked the sangria. Espresso was amazing! Strong and creamy! Perfection!

tgsmEhcSd20T6aN2VNs48w.text: I live in Los Angeles but come to Vegas at least three times a year and every time I come I make sure to eat at Texas de Brazil. If you love steak and good food then this place is a MUST! Beautiful restaurant with a professional staff that makes you feel like VIP.  The salad bar alone is worth the trip but save room for all that steak AND dessert.   Oh and if you like men in uniform...yea, you want to be here :) great eye candy  Best restaurant in town for sure!

uGpSwh3eXtmJK6h_NivSug.text: CARNIVORE HEAVEN! Now before you get that opening wrong, let me be clear...I had one of the most romantic evenings of my adult life at this place.  The restaurant is nicely dim lit. Everyone is very well dressed if you come in the evening and the person that greeted us was immediately there to take care of us and get us seated.  To make sure we weren't going to have to wait I of course booked a table in advance ;-)!  So now let me continue by talking about what you really want to hear, "the food".  "Hypnotizingly Delicious" if you could put that into those words.  Any and all meats are brought fresh and hot individually systematically to your table, "IF" you flip your card up indicating the color green for "more meat"; red means no more or, not now.  The salad bar as well was very fresh with great assortments to choose from.  And as if that wasn't enough, if you somehow managed to find a spot available inside your body cavity to consider desert, out comes the waiter with an assortment of deserts that will make you shed a tear.  The choices were so difficult we each chose two and took them home because we absolutely had no room to eat at that moment hahaha.  When shared one each later that evening they were exactly what expected from the beginning to the end of a magical and magnificent evening at Texas de Brazil.  One small note:  Gentlemen, if your significant other does not like spending money, do not let your partner see the bill as this place is a strong bit on the pricey end.  However, for an anniversary event or a rare, special occasion, I have to say it was worth every penny.  Not something I would do every month, but definitely once a year regardless of what my bank account holds.  Hope anyone that reads this finds this helpful.  My wife absolutely loved the food and atmosphere!!

jlKX2yHjTXBEkofIyjjFuw.text: My second time here,  the service was perfect and the meat selection amazing.  One of the best Brazilian grills around and I've been to many.

QBc-3Q8OlkkWF40sZ1vu2Q.text: The food was good the side dishes we're okay I did notice that they didn't bring out a lot of meats until the end tell your almost done eating not cool and I think you don't notice a okay place eat ....little pricey for what you getting

Lcpg3CbKC6NATO0xdRvhWQ.text: Don't get me wrong the selection is amazing and the food is yummy but I feel the price we pay doesn't do any justice. I'd stick to buffets than this. I do love the concept of this though, but after awhile you get sick of all the meats and some of it is a little too salty for my taste. The staff here is excellent and helpful, but this place wouldn't be my first choice.

3SG0bTTJRghs5Ru8OoaJtw.text: Amazing dinner with friends from out of town . We loved it the beef rib was amazing the bacon wrapped chicken amazing . I love love love this place . You should go with a huge appetite you will for sure need it . The bisque soup was yummy . I had a large salad and my whole group was thrilled

y3FJ_r7p9iQs9DJmldAegw.text: My boyfriend and I celebrated here for our 2 year anniversary, and it was amazing.  The price was not low, but that's only because you are paying for quality service and quality food. The meat selections were all delicious, and the salad bar was incredible. Crab rolls, asparagus, imported cheeses, salmon, hand made soups and sauces, and more. The service was very attentive, and we did not wait for refills as they were always on top of it. I will definitely be going there again, and hopefully soon.

jdW23ywyOPCit2IrLeDP3w.text: This place is a lot of fun! Our server was Felipe and he was very nice and attentive. The salad bar was delicious and all the guys with the meat were so helpful and brought anything we requested. Literally as soon as I flipped my card to green I had 3 different types of meat to choose from. It was wonderful lol! Will definitely return & recommend!

nXZE2b504xM8cfVlkVeMVQ.text: So far so good, second time here and food is still just as good. Had a time getting lamb chops but they finally came through. It was worth the wait. Estefania was great! She was very nice and attentive.. Our Anniversary was a success. We are full and all smiles.

IR4PG4-CmCCu0x7m6tjYBg.text: Fogo de chao was closed so I decided to come this place. They have bottle of sodas instead of serving with can or from soda machine. That was really cute. Service was great,had many veges at salad bar but meat was just soso. Sorry but I will go to fogo de chao instead of here

qi4k3xx4TsizoA6PVZ9ZUw.text: Holy cow.  No pun intended.  We ate so much and tried to keep it going.  Ugh.  Salad is amazing and I should have stopped there. ... But I didn't.  Filet was my favorite with the sausage a close second.  The flank steak was seasoned excellent. I finished with cheesecake and a coffee then I raced home to relax and reflect on my accomplishments.  I will go back and try to eat just the salad bar.   Maybe.

lZt8cIbsnW-4vuiuH22j7g.text: I'm a server in NYC, and absolutely adore great service! I made a reservation for this restaurant and made many second guesses about it, based on some YELP reviews. But, I don't regret it! I came to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and my waitress Franciel was such a sweetheart and very intent with us. My boyfriend and I loved the atmosphere, very unique. The Brazilian cheesecake and special drink was spot on and delish! We will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome Brazilian Cheesecake for the Birthday Boy!

jN5W862vHbaG_LhjaVO7aQ.text: This place has amazing meat and I love the concept. To be honest, via de Brazil's meat has more flavor. Either way I love this restaurant.

2bVoA2NbsFjPi7UpGwho9A.text: Went last night and it was awesome. Adam was our server and he didn't disappoint. Very prompt and courteous and very funny. Great personality. Took a little bit for the meat to start coming around but once it did, it didn't stop.

YeuInva_qx26fYlnUqNA0w.text: Our entire experience was amazing , the meat so tender and juicy . Staff was exceptional . We will be back for sure . Yes it's a little on the pricey side but for those cuts of meat it's worth it !

TC1nx_eHo8Nyafj2cahJcA.text: A fantastic, clean and spacious location.  I enjoyed all of the beef cuts and Portuguese sausage!  My favorites were the Garlic Sirloin, Beef Ribs, and Flank Steak.  It's worth every cent for the beef and Portuguese sausage.  I would give 5 stars if it was focused just on those things.  Every thing else... I wasn't impressed with. Highly recommended for fans of Brazilian BBQ!

AFvuYN-_NwWuYReuC9Ke-Q.text: Food was excellent, no doubt. Servers were quick with the meat, which was not hard as the place was more than half empty. We found it way too pricey for a Sunday lunch and also our waiter was not very well informed (e.g., he did not mention the senior discount, which would have clearly applied to my parents-in-law. We found out later on their website when it was too late). It was a great experience but due to the high price I will not go back (i.e., there is better value for money out there)

bjFQKJ2okW4I067FkOAPIA.text: I love me some good brazilian bbq.  This place is pretty comparable to Fogo De Chao, and a smidge cheaper.    The service is great.  Once we got our plates from the buffet portion, we pretty much got 4-5 types of meats on our plates within 5 minutes.  The waitress said they had kinds of meat, but I don't think we got that many.  I find that the quality of meat is not as good as Fogo, but it was still pretty good.  The filet mignon was super tender.  Their buffet section had a lot of options.   The lobster bisque was pretty good as was the smoked salmon.    This place is definitely worth trying out if you want something that's not a typical vegas buffet.  On a side note, the soda is not free refills.  You just get a small bottle.

yYvc5Jfe8DE5JzHhNLrAJg.text: First time here.. I have nothing bad to say about this place!! It was spur of the moment, so we didn't have a reservation. Waited about 30 minutes for a table.. But there was a nice bar area to have a drink while we waited. The service was great!! The food was even better!!

OrbhW80NPdPDqjsDdHE0xw.text: I took my mom here for her birthday and the food was absolutely phenomenal. Upon arriving I made a reservation and was sat immediately. We were then explained by our sever how everything worked and asked if we had any questions or requests to not hesitate on asking. We started with the salad bar where they offered wide variety of salads, cheeses, sushi rolls and salmon. After we finished with what we picked out from the salad bar we tried many of the different meats they offered and my favorite was the prime rib. We finished our meal with a flan my mothers favorite dessert. Overall the staff was friendly and the atmosphere is very clean and upscale I would recommend for any special occasion.

NYR4JS2c38upoWao7_BrGw.text: I always looked forward to coming here every time I am in Vegas. I bring all my friends here and normally really enjoy myself. My friend and I along with her 2 children came on a Wednesday night. It was not super busy since it's the middle of the week. Waiting for about 15 mins to be seated. Then we go to the salad bar and begin with our journey.   The different meats were coming around but I know exactly what I want. I'm not going to waste my time eating chicken when I can wait for the filet. Just the regular one not the bacon covered ... they ask me what am I waiting for and I tell them. They say why don't you try this instead, I nod my head and continue to wait. Mind you my salad bar was great and consistent to all the other times I have been here. My meat takes about 40 minutes to come out and he only brings burnt ones... moving along, my friend and her kids normally love  love lamb chops so they ask for 2 each. The guy looks irritated with them but gives them 2 each. They are super excited to eat it and it tasted just nasty. It tasted like lemon vinegar. Then we tried the bacon wrapped chicken since what we came for was so horrible! Guess what? Totally DRY! I couldn't believe it!! I've never came here and had the food taste this bad!! And to top it off, we had to ask for more water. The server didn't come check on us, we had to wave down another server to get water refills. The good was horrible and I dont think I will return to this location.   After paying the bill, as we were walking out, I asked to speak to a manager and the manager said I am sorry to hear this. Next time let me know earlier and we can do something about it. I was thinking to myself, there will not be a next time for us. Oh well ... 2 stars for salad bar!

IrW_O1trb2124mFFk-FrJA.text: The experience was fun. We have been to Brazilian BBQ restaurants in other parts of the country and this is on par with most. The upfront information and selection at the soup and salad bar were excellent. Our requests for service were taken care of promptly. The food was plentiful. The STOP and GO signals are not really observed by most of the servers, this was good and bad. We ate A LOT and some came when we were not expecting it but it simply sounded too good to pass up on.  Like most of Las Vegas it was expensive compared to many other Brazilian restaurants we have been to.   Overall, thanks for a good time and great food.

Ftv7IpOZ49_RysaWdu4CcQ.text: Always go here with my friends and we got Vance as our waiter twice, but he was really sweet. I told him I liked the bananas so he made sure our table always had some. It's one of my favorite places to go with friends and family to celebrate life events or to just catch up. Would definitely recommend! The atmosphere and vibes were nice throughout my whole meal.

Y7LWNDHirNpsYQQ49IG-gw.text: Idk what to say every time I go to a Brazilian restaurant the food is always great delicious flavorful amazing. The meat keeps coming eat what you can . I'll give this place 100 stars if I could but yes this place was great. The cheese cake for desert were great . If you haven't tried this place I highly recommend you try it.

SMuza2ZShgLLpF_iVtD65g.text: Vance was an excellent server. He kept everything coming and our meat requests were put in. The pichana, filet and ribeye were tender and cooked just the way I like it. They even had well done temperatures ready too. This was my first time visiting the Vegas location and it was surpassed my expectations. This restaurant located in the Town Square before you reach the strip. We left happy and full! Will be back again!

2BwTA5I_kQCfu-qn7o5SDQ.text: Walking through the doors of Texas de Brazil, I had to hold back my excitement. This is one of my favorite restaurants, but I do not live in a state that has one. My love affair with TdB has evolved as I have eaten bacon-wrapped chicken and filet mignon to my heart's content at their Orlando, Puerto Rico, and Las Vegas locations. I have casually entertained other Brazilian steakhouse restaurants, but I still have a special place in my stomach for my first. Even though it has been years since I had one of their savory, fire-roasted morsels dance across my palate, I was not disappointed. Their flavor reigns supreme and the service is impeccable. Until we meet again...

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZJMTP7nH86TC5rY8nwd2tw.text: Disappointing... a local friend recommended this place to us and said it was absolutely the best so we went in there with very high expectations. In fact, they went there the night before and came back and was raving about how delicious it was; meat so tender that it melted in your mouth.   The service was great and their salad spread was awesome but the meat is supposed to be the star and it didn't shine!  Herb-marinated pork lion - never saw it come around Picanha - salty, I like mine more on the rare side but got medium, even after I asked for rare, I just figured they didn't have it Sausage - juicy, not too bad Leg of lamb, one of the main items I came here for. I asked the waiter for it, he said he'll bring it out but never did.  Chicken breast wrapped in bacon - dry Alcatra - not really sure what this is, probably didn't come around Lamb chops - typically my favorite, you would think a place like this will do it justice but he gave me two pieces, I ate one and didn't even want to eat the other one. Normally, I can eat 4-6 of these puppies! But the one I had was salty and dry. Everything was salty and dry.  Filet mignon wrapped in bacon - salty, overcooked, dry Parmesan-crusted pork loin - never saw it come around Garlic picanha - nope Braised beef ribs - nada BBQ pork ribs - mo'ah (no in Chinese) Filet Mignon - Khong (no in Vietnamese) Parmesan drumlettes - I didn't try, it looked dried. Flank steak - I finally got a piece that was closer to the rare - medium rare side, and was able to enjoy it Cheesy bread - was flat and had a bitter after taste.  We order their special flavored lemonade; mango and passion fruit. If you love tart, than thumbs up for you. My boyfriend drinks lemonade all the time and it was too tarty for him.   If it was not for the chimichurri sauce, I probably would not have finished the meat on my plate. Needless to say, I wasn't impressed. Maybe I went with too high of an expectation.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8h8RZVlmBhHqyIqLLGNC5A.text: My best advice is to come here with an empty stomach. The salad bar has a great selection but don't let that steer you away from the carved meat selection. The lobster bisque was amazing but don't fill up too quickly on it! I personally love the house special top sirloin. The server Adam S. Did a fantastic job; although they may seem to be on a script, the wittiness of the server created a comfortable and fun experience.   I highly suggested grabbing some spring mix to balance the meat selection. I also had the guarana soda for the first time here at the restaurant and it was wonderful.   While the price is on the higher side, about $70 per person after tip, I suggest making it the experience by eating up!   I would suggest the place but I'd keep it for special occasions.

K3Oj0VuTfP29PdO_p0K4aA.text: The best. Every single flavor is spot on. Service is bar-none. Salad bar, deserts and all the extras are perfection.

ZKLcQJ4--Zkl68qxghWPvA.text: The food was outta this world... fantastic steakhouse with huge variety of cooked meats brought to your table .. constantly And a great different very tasty big variety of sophisticated salad bar... & soup bar... probably best restaurant i have eaten at... 10 stars

4X5FNTwyih3mxCQcWD0w3A.text: Went here while on business.  With so many great "buffets" in Las Vegas, I was very surprised to see so many people on a Tuesday night at Texas de Brazil.    At $52.00 per person, drinks or desert NOT INCLUDED, you better have an outstanding variety of meats and flavors.    The salad bar was very tasty and our meats were:  Picanha Sirloin Picanha Lamb Lamb Chop Garlic Sirloin Filet Mignon Bacon Wrapped Filet Mignon Beef Rib Parmesan Chicken Sausage Flank Steak and two pork dishes.  While that's plenty of meat, it began to all taste the same after a while.    For $52.00 in Las Vegas you can go to some of the better buffets and get an all included meal or save some money and go to M Buffet where your beer, wine and desserts are all included for half the price.  I am sure this review will draw some controversy, Texas de Brazil may be a great place in other parts of the country, but in Las Vegas, I felt like we made an unwise choice.

xJAV_Xgwuq0Ujz0MJsc6xA.text: Amazing service can i just say our server ryan was on point always on top if everything made sure our night was going well. He also had offered help with explaining everything throughly and made my birthday feel special. All aside for that the food quality was great definitely reasonable pricing considering all of what we have eaten and the quality. Will come again soon

xhPZkLQJK-om5zc1Fg6BgQ.text: This is just a all you can meat paradise ! I wish my stomach was tripled in size so i can just eat so much steak. I came in here on a Sunday night at around 4, and it wasn't busy at that time. Once it started hitting at 5 pm it began to be super busy. Our waiter "Richard" was very nice and helpful. I appreciated his enthusiasm working for this company.   This awesome meat factory is located on the outskirts of Town square. Plenty of parking, and the building is huge to not miss it. The inside can get a little crowded around the salad bar. I believe the salad bar you can just pay to eat there which i don't mind. So you have so many waiters walking around with meat either they serve you or skip you depending on your card.   Now for the food, my favorite part of the salad bar was the mint sauce for my steak and all the vegetables they offer. I keep going back for more ! I only eat mostly all the beef steak options. The flank steak was my favorite and ribeye steak. I give everything a 5/5 rating !!! The price is worth it, than eating at those fancy buffets at the strip. Im definitely coming back, no matter what the occasion is.

bAjTDUewQU5XrjlDTCverA.text: This place was great!. Be sure to bring your appetite, because you're going to eat a lot. It's kinda on the pricey side($34.99 for lunch & $51.99 for dinner?). Suggestion: Go for lunch, it's basically the same menu(except for a couple more dishes, desert & drinks included with dinner). It's basically a buffet, but instead of the meat sitting out(getting dry), they bring it to you fresh & hot!. They have waiters walking around with fresh cooked meats on a skewer & if you want some they slice a piece for you(steak, chicken, lamb, sausage, etc). They also have a salad bar(with a few desert items) which is very good too(included with the price). I highly recommend this place for first timers, birthday parties, graduation parties, basically any special occasion.

ZLxxcq-d6sljKMoH_hfydQ.text: This has become somewhat a classic, it's certainly the better of the Brazilian steakhouses and consistent, however they are also creeping up the price while limiting certain cuts etc and while I would still come back i do not appreciate the trajectory this place is going.  Its a no recommend for me.

7j556HS7o_8mlTk-dfyO-g.text: Definitely is a nice spot to go and have the best of the best meats and the best sides from bacon wrapped chicken to filet mignon to lamp chops they were all really good! Oh especially the flank steak, cooked a perfect medium rare and beef piccana! The sides range from romaine salad to mozzarella cheese balls to the best potato salad I've had in any restaurant. Definitely down for the garlic mashed too! We went for lunch and it was the best experience because our waitress Angel was the best! She made everything fun and she was delightful! She made us aware of the menu with the different meats and also the sides with deserts, which are included in the price. And also she told us about her favorite which was the lamb chop and that is why I tried it and also the Brazilian cheesecake which is yums!! So definitely we'll be back and look forward to our next visit! Very friendly staff! (Oh and I wish I would've tried the lobster bisque)

yInReLoj8QvBKHgylrYJxA.text: I usually love this place, but my most recent experience was thoroughly disappointing. Service was good for the first 15 mins. After that, it was impossible to find our waiter. When he finally came around, he messed the check up by charging us for the full buffets, when 1 person in our party only had the salad bar (explained when we first walked in). Also took 20 mins to finally get the guy with the hot links to come around. This was after asking everyone if they could send him by. I dont think I'd go back to this place again. On top of everything, the server had a minimum requirement of 18% tip as the lowest amount available. Excuse me but if the service is a fail and my party of 4 wasnt satisfied, I dont appreciate being told I need to give pay the guy a certain tip for the lack of work ethic. Never again

lacJnbuCaUyB54rUST_XEg.text: Garlic Picane, Flank Steak and Filet Mignon were delicious! Service was wonderful from our server Miguel to the constant Meat carvers that come to your table offering you the vast variety of their meat selection. Absolutely recommend you coming here for a special occasion of any sort, it's $50+ a person but the quality of meat selection they offer is worth it. Especially that's there's no limit on the food, you can literally eat till you drop. I highly recommend you come with an appetite, like have a small breakfast and maybe some edibles and you'll do just fine haha   Their salad bar full of sides, soups, salads and toppings is amazing. 50+ items you have the option of having. We even had a pescatarian that came with us to celebrate and she was more than satisfied with their selection at the self serve bar that had items from their lobster bisque, sushi, salads and different side items.   Dessert was delicious. We tried the Brazilian cheesecake, creme brulee, chocolate cake and the Banana fosters. All the perfect cherry on top of our meal but our favorites were the chocolate cake and banana fosters.   The overall experience we had of a group of 12 people was amazing. Definitely will be back.

OmhoGFYhsfpvQN7T8qT0DA.text: I came here for Valentine's Day and an off day in the summer. I will say that it is always a special treat to come here. Although the price is on the higher side(especially for a broke college student), I am never disappointed.  My two favorite items here are the beef ribs and lobster bisque (from the salad bar).   Also, the service here is top notch. I will continue to come back for special occasions!

ehx2uzrlV-VfVRjIwefm6g.text: One of my favorite restaurants! First time to this one. The salad bar was fresh and kept clean. They came around with the different meats but we kept missing 2 of the meats that went around. By the time they came by we were stuffed. We split a cheesecake and key lime pie. Very good so save rooms for dessert!

eFbAIlWFNM1hbPmVxbgjhg.text: This place always has great service. Especially the wait staff. This time we had Jake, who has excellent customer service skills and is equally as attentive. The meat selection is fantastic, I highly recommend their Picana sirloin steak. The salad bar has a lot to offer as well.

3w2ti-t71iNcIbgYSP665Q.text: Never leave this place hungry- that's forsure. Even vegatarians can not resist. The smell, look, and taste of all the meats is too perfect. Don't get me wrong, the salad bar is above par, but who wants to say no to the meats?? No one.
