a5h6UfID-FY-JAMiAQoS4A.text: Celebrating a special birthday and decided to try this restaurant after not dining there in many years.  First, you need a reservation.  We had one and still waited for a table.  This location is frequented by visitors to LV and not locals.  The price is much higher than it should be and it was even more disappointing when the meats we really wanted were never offered.  Filet and chicken breast with bacon, lamb chops and pork loin.  They just never came around during the whole visit.  The pork ribs were dry and chewy.   Service was strange.  The meat servers seemed almost robotic, not very friendly and quick to drop off and run.  Salad bar was okay, less offerings than last visit.  Lobster bisque was tasty, but not hot.  Maybe some other type of fish could be offered other than a odd looking fish stew that did not look appetizing.    Sorry, will not be back and will not recommend.

_kEBc9bI8UREH3Vra-dVKQ.text: I haven't posted in a minute, and I'm usually pretty lengthy on my reviews; so I'm apologizing up front for the brevity of this post.  I've been to Vegas quite a few times and have driven by this place just as much.  Located in the Town Center area just outside of the strip, is a meat lovers paradise called Texas de Brazil. No we're not in Texas nor are we in Brazil. It is however a Brazilian steakhouse with some of the most amazing flavors and and awesome salad bar you will find anywhere else. Just remember, GREEN means GO and RED means STOP.  You will know what I'm talking about, should you be so inclined to visit. But anyways, all I can say is WOW. From the front desk, to the wait staff, to the "meat" runners, and the amazing ambience.  I know there are plenty of places to eat at in Vegas, but this is a must visit and gorge place. You will definitely loosen your belt and leave hunched over!!!

V5hHhnJy2tbvGEq8CqOJxQ.text: MEAT LOVER'S PARADISE  So far this place is the best Brazilian buffet in Vegas. The meats are well cooked and everything flavored correctly. The service is exceptional. It does all come at a high cost, but its comparable to the pricing of Vegas buffets on the strip. My favorite non meat dish has to be the plantains!

1DFZhh6FhWeLDbCrtbitMA.text: We picked up $100 gift card from costco for $79.  Went for Sat lunch.  It includes soda and desert, $52/person.  I like the pineapple slices, coconut fish stew, garlic steak, beef ribs (must try), filet mignon. leg of lamb and lamb chop is a little bit gammy for my taste.  flank steak and filet mignon with bacon, and chicken with bacon wrap are good.  Cheese bread are good, slightly salty than my liking.  Fried banana is too oily, does not feel like it was fried.  Meat are mostly juicy.  My cut are mostly medium to medium rare, they do offer medium well, well done if you want.   Service was great, we ate creame brule there and chocolate cake to go.  Hobby likes them more than Via Brazil.

fkFobkzZUsq-NNfGoeEn6Q.text: Ok we came here with a large party to celebrate my niece's 21st birthday while we were in Vegas. My sister chose this place because my niece used to work at Brazilian BBQ restaurant in Portland so I think she picked it. It is just South of the Strip in an outdoor strip mall.  When you walk in, it's definitely a site to behold. Beautiful interior, open space and clean. It's a bit of a different concept, one that I was not used to and was slightly confusing, if I'm being totally honest. You each have a little circular card that has a green side and a red side. You are supposed to put the green side up if you want people to come and offer you some kind of meat, and put the red side up if you need a break. It seemed a bit overwhelming when people kept swooping in and asking if you want Filet Mignon, or Brazilian sausage, or chicken, or whatever else they offered. They keep the meat on a vertical skewer and slice it fresh for you onto your plate. But I kept saying yes. Partly because I wanted to try everything, and partly because I knew if I passed on something, I wouldn't get another opportunity to try it. They didn't come back with that dish. I felt like I never really got to sit and enjoy or savor anything because the next option was standing there waiting for you to say yes or no.  Then they also advise you to go get a plate of what I would call "sides." This was also kind of  confusing for me. I filled up more than one plate on a bunch of side dishes, which was a mistake. But I felt that it wasn't explained well beforehand so I wasn't sure what to do. They have cheeses, sauteed onions, grilled vegetables, soups, etc. Lots of stuff to pile on your plate that you're never going to actually eat.  Don't get me wrong. The food was flavorful. It was mostly all good and I enjoyed it. The prices were high. Everything. But I suppose that's normal for Vegas. To me though, I'm not sure it warranted the expense. You basically pay an AYCE fee ($50 per adult, if I recall correctly), plus drinks. And that was with a 20% discount. They were extremely reasonable with the kids though. It was so little, I don't even recall the amount. But then again, how much is your 2 year old gonna eat? In the end, it was a cool experience but I don't think I'd rush to come back. If someone else picked it again, I wouldn't balk, but I'd probably rather eat at a regular steakhouse.

ARs7VajfSrM1qUoc1FsEnQ.text: What can I say you get what you pay for . The selections of meats is amazing . They come around offering different types of meat and it's never ending . It's a very good ambiance . Would recommend going to Costco to get the gift cards they offer it's about 20 off with it .

FAkU38Q4UKXXN7alIDAbWA.text: I don't know where to start off... because everything was delicious! Plus customer service was A1. They treated us with great meat and the sides were delicious. My boyfriend and I's first time dining here was the day before Valentine's Day. We actually think it's a little better than Fugo De Chao and it's cheaper , I think. Can't beat the price of $49.99 + tax per person. Plus, we got a coupon/promo that they were giving out because of valentine's day.   We loved everything from their cheese bread to their main courses, which was the meat, so juicy and tender!! And that creme brulee was soooo good! Gotta try it! I wish I could've taken pictures but we were so hungry and enjoyed so much. I forgot. Coming back to take my parents here once they come down to visit.

zgHjzHfB42ze2S0-TuOE7w.text: This place is delicious. Their meat is just to die for. The buffet is to die for. It is a little pricy but it is so worth it. They have such a friendly service as well.

jSSJ6fzigRAjHWa9Ocf8Mg.text: Meats okay, order the Brazilian kiss though. It's on the cocktail menu. If you want good Brazilian barbecue, I recommend this okay in Los Angeles called m grill. Didn't really enjoy the sides. I sat down most of the time and was satisfied with cheese bread and average chimchurri sauce. Also, what kind of Brazilian barbecue place serves sriracha as a hot sauce?! Where's that spicy chimchurri sauce that's good with garlic meat, something they are missing too. Prob won't be bacm

pxcHVDDPshDMAnySNEr3Iw.text: I love this place! Every time I leave this place  I feel like a wheel barrel would be helpful. Lol. Great service as well.

Y5CBhtl-uDhCqQjT0Yb1qw.text: Came here for my pre-bday nomnoms! the wait was a bit lengthy 30-40mins granted it is an AYCE, so we waited patiently and worked up an appetite. Once seated, we were waited upon immediately and constantly. Our tummies could only hold so much! Thank you for being attentive gentlemen! We received a birthday treat as well. hehe thank you TDB!

pr0WHOIXJdUxjOZLgWKi_g.text: Best place I've eaten dinner. Period! I can't say enough about this place. Brazilian Sausage, flank steak, top sirloin, filet minion wrapped in bacon . Fair pricing as well.

8vVKQ11CyI2OfbX9eaMQZQ.text: Super bad service super rude !!! Ugly hostess can't believe people go there and waiting over 1 hour  I go there ask for table for 2 and the hostess told me 30min ! After 1hour I was waiting I go back to her ask what's going on ! She told me I am waiting only 50min and it should take 20min more ! I told here I can't wait 20min do she told me she will try do it 10min so I just was polite if it will be 10min for sure and she told me you know what I am canceling it !! Like it's not enough I was waiting 1 hour for nothing !!! Also want to mention when I was waiting there was more then 15 empty tables!!! Super rude and the most terrible service I ever saw in my life !!!! Don't go there

wW14eDmRDvdMT1jRH5GRuw.text: I've eaten here several times and loved it, but went again last night for a birthday party a got food poisoning.  The other 3 in my party were fine. The only thing different that I ate and they did not is the lamb.  So pretty sure that's the culprit. That was the only meal I ate that day so I know it was from there. It's unfortunate, it's one of my favorite places to eat.

vYOc2Py6SqtXJms_cn0glw.text: All I can say is that I looooooved it. I've been to places back East, this was way better. I was worried about it being to franchisee but nope, the experience was nice. Our server was attentive and the fish stew was so yummy. I can't wait to go back, we left full and satisfied.

v-NsYoDDYMbVs9bA_HYs0Q.text: Make sure you are hungry and you like to eat meat. The style of a Brazilian BBQ is to have servers roving around the dining floor with a variety of meats. They stop by your table and offer you some of the meat they are offering. These meats include filet mignon, filet mignon wrapped in bacon, sausage, Parmesan pork, bacon wrapped chicken, flank steak, ribs, etc. You will be given a button to put on your table that indicates whether you want the servers to stop by or not.   The meats are high quality and they also offer some side dishes in addition to full access to a large salad bar. The side dishes include mashed potatoes, cinnamon fried bananas, and Brazilian cheese bread. The salad bar has soups, salads, cheeses, vegetables, deli meats, and some other food items.   It's basically a gourmet buffet with a twist. The service is attentive and if there is any meat you are looking for in particular, you can just ask.   My only complaint would be the price, but for what you are getting and the experience, the price is actually very reasonable. It's a great place to celebrate a special occasion or dine out to.   The inside area, while large, doesn't feel like you are in a large buffet dining hall. The lighting is dim and feels intimate even though there are lots of nearby tables.   Make sure you get a reservation if you are dining with a large group, or be prepared to wait 30-45 minutes in peak times.

xvPU-Tkyd36RDZbQHFNZFw.text: The ambience of this place is good. Some of the meat that is served are okay, majority though is not up to par, they're either tough or bland. For the price you pay the quality of meat should be better. Depending on where you seat some of the the meats will rarely get your table. They need to make sure that the servers hit all the tables on a regular basis.

N2ueGbQZ9Gf5GF62fg_YuQ.text: We just had our first visit. My husband had been raving about restaurants like this. And for good reason!! The food was wonderful! Such a nice change of "type of restaurant." I loved the exotic choices.  The only thing I would critic is the attitude of some of the meat servers. But they could have just been having a bad night. Wonderful restaurant!

M1NKL7NmpQc7RYTF9vlwig.text: First time trying Brazilian BBQ and we were not disappointed! The men bringing around the various meats were all very friendly and accommodating. The salad bar was good and so was the service. Come hungry!

7CMXpeUnYXjcfRn0096q0g.text: It's ok. I'm torn because the service was very good. But all of the meat, even after we asked for medium rare... was at least medium. Usually well done. And oh so salty. Yikes. I wouldn't tell people to come here.

TiigZbfmH2s_Cz9Db2dA3w.text: Now thats what I am talking about.... I wish i could do this everyday... I would be 400 lbs within the month...

jzagmB4dBOPtLmxdbqwdTw.text: I purchased a vip dining card. I called today to make a reservation and I'm told they won't accept my reservation. I asked about walk ins and I was told a party of 5 is going to be difficult to get seated and 3 to 4 hour wait time!! Your restaurant sold me and many others a service, you should be able to provide it!!

fv8lFWRJWQXmCwzcwmtCxQ.text: From past visits I would give this restaurant 5 stars, but not on my last visit. My father made reservations for the family for my birthday. We even got a call the day of to confirm our reservation. When we arrived, we gave them our name and they looked at us with a blank look and said they did not have our reservation. I showed her the call back number and the hostess really didn't seem to care. Not the best way to start my celebration. After waiting, we were given the table right behind the hostess stand, so forget atmosphere. I felt every breeze that came in when the doors opened. Our service was ok, we had to ask for refills, and sat some time waiting for the meats to come by our table. We ordered dessert, no candle to celebrate. My guess was the waiter was never told. Even though it was mentioned when making the reservation and when we arrived. Overall the food was good, but very much a lack of customer service.

X_kgP2IYzq0SCdx0oMwy2A.text: Amazing food, great ambiance. Very good date night restaurant.

56hCOoLMnjWnsH-Cee0eZw.text: Celebrating mom's Birthday!!!  Mouth-watering all u can eat meat however they mostly served medium & I prefer my meat in a well done side, don't want bloody juice in my steak. Salad is phenomenal, lobster bisque sooo good & u dipped in warm moist cheese bread bites. The

8esDnD2ZPB3vue2VQtKTBw.text: Delicious food and excellent wait staff. The Groucho's know what they are doing and the meat is perfect every time. The salad bar is fantastic and expansive. I have to say that my favorite items are the unbelievable lobster bisque and the Brazilian cheesy bread. All that said, there are better chuscarria (sp?) restaurants in town that do it even better. There are also worse ones so of the about 5 in town I've been to this one rates second.

Q-4B9Oc7224noqsDaxt6XQ.text: Awesome place! If you are a carnivore like me and you can eat, you will love this place! Loved everything from the bread to the salad bar to all the delicious meat you can eat. You must try the Brazillian cocktail! One of the best drinka ive ever tried. Was pretty expensive but i dont mind spending more for a great meal and not leaving hungry. Wait staff very professional with great service and super friendly! Def go back when in vegas again.

oMIfwD3S4AsHBuRgymCHBQ.text: My Brazilian friend and I had been disappointed at another Brazilian restaurant in town and weren't going to give up on our quest to get a decent Brazilian meal here. That we did at Texas de Brazil. It's a huge, beautiful, busy restaurant. You get tons of food, especially meat, barbecued meat, which is what Texas de Brazil is all about. I absolutely loved the Picanha cut of meat, which is a type of sirloin, because it was so tender and moist. Next time I go that's the only meat I will eat...no I think I'll still want to try others, but I will definitely get my fill of that. The salad bar was also excellent, and it was nice to try different Brazilian sides and veggies. But don't make the mistake that I did and fill up on that salad bar. I had little room for my Picanha (try it, you won't regret it). The service was good, and the only downside was that it's very expensive. I know it's all you can eat meat, but still it's expensive. Next time we're going during lunch. Anyway, I really loved the place, and can't wait to go back when my friend has money!

uly-Y4Jwf9VIRV5-g2GRZg.text: If you are a meat lover this is is a place to be! I kept on asking for well done but for some reason they forgot about us. The other part I don't like about this is that my table area seems to be dark and I couldn't see what I am eating. I ate the mashed potato and I bit something crunchy since it was so dark I couldn't tell what it was. Overall the food is SO-SO. The ladies in the front needs to improve their customer service starting with saying "Hi".

6J0wOp5Pq_z2n2PxBBR1xQ.text: The meats are absolutely the best. I have been there many times and he food is always top notch.  Their salad bar is amazing as is their Lobster Bisque.

LN2AoUPMsEAfXTUDsS4V-A.text: we made reservations here for my wifes moms birthday and nine of our family mebers. we were quickly seated and the atmosphere was great and the food even better they have a great salad bar and the waiters are very polite and professional. the food was incredible and the parking was no problem. we love this place and will definitely be going there again.

RW2dlEr4Xm2vi84wzBIC9Q.text: I've never been to a restaurant as beautiful as this one. From the decor to the food, everything was gorgeous. I didn't have room for all of the soups, salads and meats but everything I had was absolutely delicious. The customer service was tops. I can't wait for my next visit here.

bcyZY0d1J_nilaNQ-nQV7g.text: Excellent food for the carnivore! Excellent table side service, and a well stocked bar. I advise arriving early enough to enjoy a glass or two of their house merlot.

6C9KiU7510mNE9gp2F0PcA.text: Delicious all the way, along with expensive as well. For the 2 of us we paid $124 with a tip included. Salad bar and a small hot plate station. Wait staff always late in picking up plates or to pour your drink.

dPach2_icegBdxq0uKhUwA.text: Excellent service. Extremely good meat. Salad bar a little wanting. Lobster bisque was the soup -- delicious if a bit salty.   Tip: get the menu with all of the meats and plan ahead. Don't accept whatever is offered. Pace yourself. Suggest you try the Brazilian picahna, filet with bacon, lamb chops and beef spare ribs.  Meat is all buttery soft and perfectly prepared. I love the picahna and the filets were tender and juicy. Food was hot (temperature not spice) which can be a risk when theyre walking around with it like that. The parmesian encrusted pork was a little dry for me, but the beauty of this place is that you can set it aside and go for something else. The lamb chops were incredible; I normally avoid lamb (gamey in my opinion) but acquiesced after my friend insisted--glad I did.   My guest had a few drinks and I stuck to water. Total bill with generous tip $200. Worth it. Didn't eat for 24 hour after that meal. I will be back.

zZtbHjLgqJKTI7z010Q_BA.text: It's was a great atmosphere  the service was great and the food was better. My only issue with this place  was there bathroom  it was a mess. In one of the stalls was a used diaper and the others had pee all over them. I would recommend  to my friends. They just to watch there bathroom.

DB0jPj6RsqJz54uu5r8x4w.text: The greatest restaurant in the entire world. every year, for the man trip to vegas, we always meet up here. I come here every chance I get, the house sirloin and the bacon wrapped filet are the best. just don't eat for a few days ahead of going. trust me.

p4OK2Lgwt9V9E0vCoM27uA.text: This place was amazing came here after my last day of my work convention. The servers amazing. They pair the wine perfectly. Will be back here!

ULJo_TNGNLuvLpxG-yttIA.text: 1st time and at 6 o'clock it was very busy but it wasn't a long wait, our server was very helpful the salad bar was really good the lobster bisque was good the meats were also good the banana foster pie the key lime pie were good.if you're ready to eat lots of good food this is the spot

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great desserts
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XrJ8TDIoemw7_BtKRW71-Q.text: Terrible people. Good food. We come here whenever we are in town, on one particular occasion a server dropped a drink on my little girls head, she was soaking wet and screaming...we didn't even get to eat our food we had to leave. When I got home I called the general manager unhappy about what happened...and he said next time we come back in town he would take care of our dinner(we are from Boston) when I called back the same manager basically laughed in my face and said he will not honor what we promised! How could they hurt a little girl and not even care? Extremely rude management staff I will never refer anyone here again.

sH0yJfoMoI4xur5-6eFwFg.text: Not for vegetarians or "light fare" eaters... The flank steak, beef ribs and lamb chops are the business! Their condiment/salad bar is on point! Lobster bisque good; a bit sweet The cheese curds and plantains are second to none! If it weren't for the lady behind me at the birthday with her booty over my shoulder (my date's((she's beautiful)) face was in WTF OMG GTFOH mode for about 5 minutes) I'd have given 4.5 but it took the staff a while and some coaxing... All in all it's great, and every cocktail has kick! Good job, the staff is attentive and polite  Advice: any day you decide to go, make a reservation... They're always busy

qz7tN70whwbz-IXk7auerg.text: First visit last night to celebrate the birthdays of two famiky members. Party of six. Location and decor is great and the food is fantastic. I especially enjoyed all the exciting choices on the salad bar. Had to lower my rating, unfortunately, due to the service. Hostess and meat servers were top-notch, but our table server was less than attentive. We had to ask for clean plates after finishing our salads; drinks were not refilled in a timely manner; dirty plates were not removed;  and our server disappeared for at least 15 minutes more than once. My mother waited 10 minutes for a cup of coffee, which was eventually brought to her by another server. Very disappointing component to what could have been a memorable evening.

1KUpjtXf-5QFH1NKn2t67w.text: All you can eat steak .... And good staff ... Little costly but you can eat your size in meat you will not need to eat for the rest of the day for sure , if your in the mood for good meat an eats this is the spot

ojZSxLH-a5ZL1ynzJ4sd-w.text: Another great meal at this wonderful Steak house. Went there when in Vegas in mid April. The meats are fresh and plentiful. The sausages and ribs were outstanding. The salad bar is well stocked with the usual variety of greens, the cucumber salad rocked and some Brazilian specialties you must try. The service is top notch. We had Sangria, as usual, best in the West! This time we tried dessert. Don't miss the cheesecake.

FsmiBbdkcujoyl3cLbXFCg.text: Always a great experience! Good food, great salad bar, terrific lobster bisque, outstanding service! We've been there 4 times and every time it's been very good.

5ViqR6K3xhIgLTpbLeF1QA.text: Twice I've been tot he Texas de Brazil in Irvine/Tustin, California.  SUPERB!  Everything was perfect:  the food, the salad bar, the service.  However, the LAS VEGAS Texas de Brazil was quite the opposite.  The meat (beef/steak) was tough regardless of the type (flank, ribs, filet) and the service from our assigned table server was practically non-existent.  The salad bar was excellent, same as in California.  Not sure I'd try this restaurant again the next time I'm in Nevada as it just wasn't up to the standards expected.

yOAMhQ-v_a_74vg7LK-CQw.text: My husband and I, ate here for the first time! And let me tell you!! Probably the best place to eat if you love all you can eat filet Mignon!! And of course all the other wonderful meat choices they have, which are ribs, lamb,my strip and much more! My ultimate favorite though was the bacon wrapped filet, and reg filet. Also all you can eat salad bar! Great atmosphere and wonderful service! Thank you for the great experience! We will be back! :)))

zES2d0buwMw9EYo2tCulnQ.text: I came here for my birthday and was pretty excited because I love the Texas De Brazil in Fort Worth, TX. Well I told them how I like my meat cooked, but they never once got it right. The meat was either overcooked or undercooked. I am giving a 3 because the salad bar was great and our waiter did try to fix the issue. Don't think I'll come back.

yU3nde9p-ayavwA7ee7ibA.text: I've eaten here twice in the past. It's my annual guys dinner every year I'm in Vegas. The food is non-stop and incredibly good. Make sure you come on a empty stomach! Is a little pricey, but worth it...and the service is good!

4xZBOip8Tu0XUR5P2xsk7Q.text: Excellent place for a celebration we visited this place for Father's Day. And not only did they treat you with great service but our server was more then he needed to be. My little one was being a bit fussy and he attempted to keep her busy. He didn't have to but he went out of his way to make us feel comfortable. That was extremely appreciated. Just make sure you come in here with appetite and the unlimited salad bar was AMAZING. totally would recommend.

-5ERJtaZDIYGy5Xfh2fFxg.text: I love this place. Te atmosphere is alway great and the food is amazing.  Staff is very friedly and helpful

gZLWexnI55MuOSRIb75LCw.text: What a beautiful restaurant with delicious food and the meats were to die for.  I was always fearful of Brazilian steakhouses but this one was tops.  The sides were offered buffet style and there are sooo many delicious cold and hot sides that you can get full on just that.  Then the parade of meat came and it was glorious.  Frenched lamb chops, house sirloin, chicken, beef ribs, pork ribs, sausages.  I was deliciously overwhelmed!  The service was exceptional.  They not only keep coming around but they even ask if you have favourited that they will bring in higher frequency.  I wish we had this place in Canada but I definitely have a food coma so I think I am good to dream of this place until I return again to Vegas!

ev6wCuE0ACVyp279S7th6A.text: Recently had lunch for my bday here with my family. The meat that had us going was the lamb chops!! Beautiful place when u want some quality meat. The best! My little sister had her wedding reception here few years back. Service was perfect!!! Can't wait to go back.

P5YU0lxCnp9UKOpU_sOWHQ.text: Best Brazilian steakhouse in town.  Nurses, militaries, police officers, EMTs & teachers can get 20 % discount anytime. Been here several times

9d74GwE6rfSPCaf8ah4Q4Q.text: Love this restaurant great food, fantastic service. The meats are so tasty, I love that you have different choices, one of my favorite neat was the lamb. Omg to die for I think I want to go back just thinking about it.

I_Rse-sQLXivEox0FJMWbg.text: OH. MY. GAH!!!! If you want some tender, juicy, flavorful meat, GO HERE! We went for my cousins birthday and the food was off the charts. The salad bar was off the charts, and then the meat just sent everything over board. We ALMOST went to Fogo de Chao....so glad we changed our minds and decided to go here. EVERYTHING was great!!. We weren't huge fans of the Parmesan crusted items, but everything else was top notch. The seasoning was out of this world. Fogo de Chao and Samba don't have anything on TDB when it comes to flavor or meat selection. The lamb and filet mignon were our favorites. TDB is on the list for EVERY vegas trip from now on!

m-7cwcZXjbZfvVaWqvMwwA.text: Was kind of dissappointed here. Not as good as the other brazilians ive been to. Was a little to salty. Still good though.

5RMpRT6DylxF5uTjZhZLrQ.text: Came here on Easter Sunday to celebrate starting a new job.  Despite the crowd, we were seated very quickly and the service was just as attentive.  Food was great, and atmosphere was equally pleasant.  Would definitely come back and definitely recommend to others.

ccXwcVQKz9ucS3wm7oECGQ.text: One of my best dinning experience ever.. My husband made reservations here for my birthday and i loved it.. The atmosphere is great.. Service is great and the FOOD.. AMAZING!!! I love the whole idea of having servers come serve me delicious meat.. From lamb to chicken to beef.. They have it all! SALAD BAR was great too! It was a fun night.. Definitely recommend!!

YAk7p_Gig8pmPAUgWiWKnA.text: Wow! This place is fantastic, if you're a meat lover. There's definitely more than just meat. They have a whole line of soups, veggies, and cheeses. The service there is also incredible, all of the staff is super friendly and actually hold a conversation with you. I don't have kids, however, every time I've gone in and seen families take their little ones, they're very kind. Super great place to binge out on and feel like a vip. Also, their cheese rolls are fantastic!

F8uSx0fvTJiMUEPRNec4xw.text: Had such a great food experience here. Be ready to eat a lot. The buffet options were delicious and the meats were great too! Definitely recommend this place

_JkLFLToNzPelecVZPVipw.text: Today we came for my boyfriends birthday, I set up the reservation through Open Table and they had the table set and ready upon arrival.   After we all sat down from the salad bar we quickly started getting offered different meats, bacon wrapped chicken, flank steak, filet mignon, bacon wrapped cream cheese stuffed jalapenos, potatoes, bread, if our plates started getting empty they would ask for any personal requests and were happy to bring them out as asked!   I could go on and on about each individual choice but you won't be disappointed with anything you choose! The service was amazing and prompt, our glasses stayed full and plates stayed covered. I had the creme brulee after our feast, and was 110% satisfied. Can't wait to come back!

B0uBEyvV4JzZTRL_9IdjqA.text: My husband and I were in Vegas for my Birthday weekend. This place recommended to me by my co workers. We wanted to try something different. let me tell this place was awesome. Our server was excellent, I forgot his name. Omg... the food was awesome. the sides to the meat was perfect. The meat was coming so fast that I couldn't keep up!! I will definitely be returning

Dxt3Hwa4TatWXgrFruv_gA.text: Highly recommend. Carnivores Delight. I recommend making a reservation to skip the wait.

SAMZpocKz-1wheNUAjaWgQ.text: We've eaten at three different Brazilian steakhouse. Texas de Brazil is the best, especially for the price ($49.99, kids 6-12 $24.99), which was a bit less than the last churrascaria we tried. The meat was tender, juicy, and flavorful. By far the best meat of any churrascaria. The salad bar had excellent cheese, meats, vegetables, soups, and salads as expected. The popover-like rolls and plantains were good. The only disappointment were the mashed potatoes. Service was very good, and the servers passed as soon as we turned over our cards and asked if we wanted a specific meat. It's impressive when service is good when we opt to not order beverages.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

63w4Z5W4Zq97kZX1FUYpZQ.text: The reason I don't bother going to casino buffets in Vegas anymore, I first came to Texas de Brazil about 7 years ago. I've been to other Brazilian BBQ restaurants like Fogo & they all come up short in comparison to Texas. I've even been to the one in Miami beach & they have the same quality as this Las Vegas location.  Whenever I'm in town I always bring friends that have never been here, and they always love this place. It's a must try, if you plan on going for dinner during the weekend make sure you call a few days in advance for a reservation to get the time you actually want, this place gets packed on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. creme brulee
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New lunch hours.

NjkV5R7uo10NcNXoozxUrA.text: Great food, great staff, great service, great ambiance. Definitely won't be my first time here. Came here to celebrate an anniversary and the staff did not disappoint even on a busy weekend night!  The salad bar and soup was fresh and eloquent selections to enjoy. Wine list was superb and enjoyed a caipirinha. The banana caramelized with brown sugar side was superb in flavor. Just kept asking for it and the cheese rolls with the lobster bisque. The meat selections great from sirloin to filet mignon. All best meat quality.  Highly recommend when in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great table Cabernet wine

3MxbIo7zFFaVi189ne8lYA.text: Ugh if my wallet could afford this place, I'd go all the time. I absolutely the love the quality of the meats here. They have amazing customer service and the lobster bisque and top sirloin is to DIE for. It's approximately $50 all you can eat, but definitely worth it. Can't wait to go back

_70fhvIXxQ3fctc0OXwXKA.text: I have been here a handful of times and it is always a great place! The staff is friendly and has an energetic and upbeat attitude. It's $50 for dinner per adult and you have access to their large salad bar which includes salad, cold sides, soup, potatoes, meat and cheese, sushi, and plenty of other options for the table. The salad bar has a huge tropical floral arrangement in the center.  You start at the salad bar and then move on to the meat! You get a small circle chip with green on one side meaning you want the carvers to come to the table and red on the other meaning you do not want any more meat. There are gentlemen who walk around the restaurant with different types and cuts of meats on a spit and they cut small pieces for you. The meat is cooked medium rare but it's so flavorful!   The restaurant itself is quite large with a huge wine selection. The tables are smaller and intimate; the lighting dim. I would say typically you spend around 1-1.5 hours dining. This is a great place and I will keep coming back!

M79OI5ZqtD07zrlG1NkeFQ.text: I came here to celebrate my 27th birthday. When I called to make the reservation, I was asked if I were celebrating anything special, and I said yes, my birthday. When we arrived at the restaurant, our hostess again asked whether we were celebrating any special occasion, and again, I replied "birthday." Somehow, none of these notes were communicated to our server though, and my birthday was never acknowledged, even though a neighboring table got a slice of birthday cake with a candle. I even used a birthday $25 off two dinners coupon during this meal, so I don't know how much more obvious I could have been.  My little grudge aside, the interior of this Texas de Brazil, like all Texas de Brazil locations, is quite opulent. Service is attentive and they will come by to fold your table napkin when you are up getting food.   Prices are standard, $50 for dinner for all-you-can-eat meats + salad bar.   I think the meats here are on the saltier side (some cuts more than others), so I prefer the meat at Fogo de Chao better, though I strongly prefer the salad bar at Texas de Brazil. Plus, Texas de Brazil salad bar has lobster bisque!  Overall, a great place to come when celebrating a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef.
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausages, chicken, pork.
Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan drumette.

i6Ut7jAZCXi6YjFxU_FTWg.text: We booked our reservation through their website. It is VERY deceptive as we were in Las Vegas and when we booked it, it made a reservation for us in Newport Beach. When we called to confirm our reservation, we were told everything was set. We showed up for our 6:30 reservation in Las Vegas and were met by a very snooty (and I'm being nice) woman at the front desk. She just shook her head, with her snooty nose in the air and told us we had no reservation. Then some guy in a tuxedo came over and told us that there was nothing he could do for us. We left and called the number on the website and of course the Newport Beach location answered. The girl on the other line told us that this was the first time this had happened. I wouldn't eat at this stuck up, snooty joint if you paid me!!

VY7tux6-YYOePrmmZo8x9A.text: I just walked out and can't get over how awesome our experience was! This was the first time we came to Texas de Brazil (have been to other Brazilian steak houses) and this was by far my favorite! Our server Alejandro blow us away! He was so friendly, shook our hands when we came in, and was so hospitable the entire time.  The food was perfect! There wasn't a single item that didn't make me melt when taking a bite.  We will definitely be back!

RSHEEXRrJEMLImRbc-9R0g.text: An outstanding dining experience, started with a unique and massive salad bar where you can choose from a host of over 50 items.  Come back as much and as often as you like.  The salad dressings are spectacular.      This was our first time in.  My wife eats no meat and still Texas de Brazil's salad bar full of  delightful cheeses, shrimp salad, tabbouleh,  lobster bisque, a variety of roasted and grilled vegetables, sushi, smoked salmon and other salad items kept her happy and contented.  Additional sides, like potatoes au gratin, yucca, rice, and sauteed mushrooms are available in, yes you guessed it, an endless supply.  As you return to your table and begin to dine on your salad bar choices, you enjoy not one waiter, but many as the "Passadors" who are constantly walking the restaurant with giant skewers of meat brought to your table and carved table side continually ask if you would care for whatever they are carrying.  The endless supply of meats include Parmesan encrusted chicken, pork tenderloin, barbecue ribs, a spicy chicken breast, lamb chops, venison, sausages, plain or bacon wrapped filet mignon, chicken drumsticks and bacon wrapped chicken.   The passadors come often and with delicious varieties of meats, seasoned to perfection and done to whatever temperature you might desire.  The meal includes select drinks and dessert if you have any room left.  Service is fast and impeccable.  The environment is upscale and casual offering very comfortable seating.  We will return often. Texas de Brazil turned out to be a wonderful and delightful surprise and value.  We commend this restaurant to you without reservations.

bM5zSUk7x6o4aOlU8dF3Zw.text: Holy meat!!! This place has so much damn meat.   Ok for $49.99 this is a good deal for meat lovers. I wouldn't say it's the best meat but it will do the job if you want ayce meat. Comes with a salad bar, not a typical salad bar though which is good. Tons of veggies, cheese, olives, and even some warm sides.  Come prepared to eat because there is just so much food.   Service is ok. It's just so crowded in here that it's hard to hear and they come around so fast with the meat that you barely have time to make a decision.  Just a little tip, bring an extra plate from the salad bar and use that for your meat because when they do come around and you say yes to the meat they will just place it anywhere on your plate.

JQDfdzqsvpt6OaluAToVew.text: Went here on a Saturday night.  The beef and the lamb were what I ate so I can't comment on the rest.  They were good. Some better then others. Next time I will get more of others.  I'd skip the mint sauce as it was a bit too sweet and fake tasting.  The salad bar was good. I loved the peppers and prosciutto.   The green pea dish was great.  I also liked the spicy peppers but careful they are very hot.  Definitely try the lobster bisque so smooth and velvety. I didn't eat anything else off the hot bar but the mashed potatoes on the table were also very smooth.  The food is 4 star but the reason for my 3 was my table. They wedged me in a table right at the front 5 feet from checkin it was like dining in the lobby and it was pretty rude.  I'm not sure I will go back if that is how they're going to treat guests that aren't the large parties they seem to cater to.

D5wl0XFAjYv0mJczC4RgYA.text: This place was excellent.  The service and ambiance was really nice.  We had a party of 8 and a baby and they sat us in a comfortable table area with enough room for everyone.  The meats were all delicious and the choice of sides was out of this world.  I enjoyed the salad bar as much as the meats.  The server was really good about getting the meats we requested brought around and they were not stingy with the portions when serving you. The garlic steak was my personal favorite and the rack of lamb was next, the hearts of palm, beets, different selection of salad dressings, potatoes was .We are definitely looking forward to our next visit!!!!

0MtUGHny_2QvGKfuVcC_7A.text: I can't believe I'm Actually gonna write about this place. I'm really upset that I gotta do this but I have to be honest. This is actually my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I have celebrated my last 3 birthdays here and I make sure everyone in my party tips greatly because that's the kinda person I am. I was really good friends with the General Manager David back in the day. I recently went to Texas de Brazil and I have 8 people with me. I had a reservation and the hostess refused on seating us because 3 people were missing. I said are you serious? We finally get sat and everything seems to be going great till we get our checks. I had 2 nurses in my group and they informed me they give discounts for doctors and nurses and ETC. I then say oh that's great. I get my servers attention and I then tell him I'm actually a doctor DVM. The servers than say oh it's only for regular doctors. I look at him and say are you kidding? A doctor is still a doctor whether it's humans or animals. I discard his stupid comment and ask him if he can add my bill to my friends since they are nurses and he looks at me and says I have to ask my manager because of the bill Is already discounted and all. It was so embarrassing for me and my guest. I just then paid but I admit I didn't tip because I was disappointed. For a 50 dollar restaurant, the service was terrible. I guess I won't be attending this place ever again.

_qZDuvNdoEljO4x-jcDEKg.text: The food was OK.  The service was another story.  The server (Adam) may have auditioned and failed for a comedian and he was trying to perform instead of waiting the table.  We felt uncomfortable and did not enjoy the experience there.

FfFzpummkfAHCyM0B-02rw.text: Came here for my boy's bachelor party dinner and we were all thoroughly impressed.  Meat upon meat upon meat upon meat.  Even our vegetarian friend was able to eat, although only from the "salad" bar; luckily for a lower price.  The meat was fantastic, the service was great, (although I learned a thing or to about it, which I will report upon in a bit), the "salad" bar was great.  So if everything was so great, why the four stars?    Yes, everything tasted fantastic but the price point is off.  I know that you are getting AYCE and that the food is of a higher quality but something seemed off.  I eat a ton so I was fine paying the price but all of my other buddies ate so little (comparatively) so it seemed unfair that they would have to shell out as much as I did.    When it comes to the service, all of the meat waiters were swarming our table for the first 15 minutes and then it slowed, which is fine but then 10 minutes later, it just about stopped completely even though we still had our green cards out.  Turns out you can have any meat waiter sent to your table if you ask your waitress which is really nice, I just wish we would've been told that instead of waiting for 15 minutes with an empty plate of food, looking around for any meat waiter to come by.  Really good place with really good food.  I am surprised it took me this long to go there and will definitely be back!

gtI0F-YzhjGbUg28fh5N6w.text: Amazing. Atmosphere is stunning. The salad bar is exquisite. It's really more then a salad bar. Service is great and the choice of meats is wonderful. My favorite place to eat for special occasions when I go to Vegas.

sV4-IiT-0Zgzs00G-dW8wA.text: Decent dinner.  Good wine with great friends.  The meat keeps coming and coming.  The side dishes from the buffet are well....... buffet,  with the exception of the lobster bisque.  Worth a shot.

iVXK0Fi_DxAv3nT0_6qIdQ.text: Food and service were good. Noise level made it impossible to have conversations. The experience did not feel as upscale as other locations I've visited.

DyL82KgOncP4ku0gziqZqA.text: Was super excited to try this place out but felt like the food was mediocre at best. The mashed potato side dish was barely warm along with all the meats they brought around. Most of the meats I received were super chewy, hard to swallow, and had little to no flavor. The only meat I enjoyed was the filet wrapped in bacon. The lobster bisque soup was decent but lukewarm like all the other food. The service was excellent though, 5 stars to the staff!

Qz48xQIrRwMPFy6pgamnVQ.text: Went to Texas de Brazil for a friend's birthday this past weekend. This place is absolutely amazing!! There is plenty of steak and other meat products to go around. If you're a vegetarian or not, check out the salad bar. They have tons of healthy food items like lettuce, green beans and pineapple. Also, don't forget to try out their dessert! They have an excellent variety of cake flavors. I'm already making plans to come back to this place.

robnSnA9BMagXdlXTkAYcA.text: Nina was an excellent server.   I've been here a few times and it's always excellent   It's so much food so don't fill up on the salad bar.   Place is every clean

dB8Nsu46lFdho1XhdA5jfg.text: So I've been going to Texas de Brazil for a few years and the service and food in general sucks they have gotten bad the carvers well around like they don't wanna be there and what was once a great restaurant with great service is now mediocre and I will never go back time to find a new Brazilian Steak house that cares about service

LA_LJrqWAiJQWKSEwx8RPg.text: Forced to update my review and lower by 2 stars. Two in our party got sick tonight we believe from the grape salad.   Also it was a promotional evening in which they had roll back pricing to be half off. We were lucky enough to get reservations but this will probably be our last time at Texas de Brazil.   Our waitress was not friendly or nice, we felt rushed. She spilled ice at one person and tapped another's fork with the ice pitcher. Service was below basic standards for this type of restaurant even with the promotional pricing.   Between 2 people getting sick and bad service, I will be recommending a different Brazilian restaurant to others.

ZF1Md4NOXB6A4t8ObU6UNg.text: Best restaurant I've ever been to in my life! Mouth dropped and was a bit overwhelmed with the selection of foods. Peter our server was excellent as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Son Dayden enjoying the experience!

D335mak7MRsUG2DvPv9OyA.text: Came here for dinner with my parents the other night on Tuesday evening. I had set a reservation 2 weeks prior and got a broad pick of reservation times available. My mom's coworker had a VIP card that they had gotten earlier in the year that allows 10 stamps/people at 50% off before the expiration date (in this case, was 09/27/18).   Lunch. $32.99, salad area only $19.99 Dinner. $51.99, salad area only $29.99 Weekend Lunch. $51.99, salad area only $29.99  We had arrived promptly at 7pm and there were tons of people waiting around the entrance outside and inside the restaurant. We were told to wait about 5 minutes and it was fairly accurate. After they cleared out a few parties around us, we were sat down at a table as well.   Salad area w/ a wide range of stuff ranging from sliced tomatoes and mozzarella balls to hearts of palm to smoked salmon, various salads, charcuterrie like salami and prosciutto, and pineapple carpaccio  Hot items like moqueca fish stew, lobster bisque, sauteed mushrooms  At the table, the waitress brings garlic mashed potatoes, sweet fried bananas, and brazilian cheese bread.   I recall the mashed potatoes had a texture similar to aligot (thick, almost malleable). Brazilian cheese bread still as good as i remembered.   This is my 3rd time coming to TdB but last visit was at least 5 years ago. Reason why I haven't came back was due to TdB being the highest priced brazilian bbq and they were quite salty overall.   This time, surprisingly, the meats were much more flavorful and less salty. The "Picanha", "Lamb Chop", and "Garlic Filet" were my favorites this time around.   According to wiki/YouTube/etc, "Picanha" is essentially the "cap" of the top sirloin, before the 3rd? blood vessel, or something like that. Cut WITH the grain to skewer and cook, but cut AGAINST the grain when eating. MmmMmm But simply said, its a strip of meat, with a cap of fat on top, making each bite have a little piece of fat ! The slices with a roasted edge and slices w/o both are good in their own ways.   Lamb chops is lamb chops. Nice, flavorful little tomahawks of lamb. Add a little chimichurri and MMmmMmm ! Mildly overcooked though...  3rd one, i wasn't sure if it's "Garlic Filet" or "Garlic Picanha"... Only thing listed w/ garlic is picanha but i recall them saying filet... Anyway ! its like a small nugget of meat, more resembling filet. Nice flavor.   Brazilian Sausage was flavorful and firm. I think good for breakfast. HAHA ! Flank steak was fairly tender as well.   I picked up some asparagus and sauteed mushrooms to eat with the meat, which helps make it not to boring.   Service was really good. The waitress who helped us frequently checked up on us, kept my water cup full, even when it barely went down. Also ! she helped send some "special requests" over if there are things you want and havent gotten or what not.   Unfortunately, this stomach is no where near what it used to be able to hold. So didn't get to try as much of a variety. Opt'ed to just get picanha a few times over to satisfy a craving and not hunt for picanha around town to try to make it myself. XD Good meal with the deal i came for. Otherwise, kind of steep for how much i can eat nowadays (sad face)

cN2cczY56JzYTRYc85WxvQ.text: The restaurant is busy and clean but the attention to detail is a little lacking. The lobster bisque would have been great if it were a little warmer than room temperature, the servers friendly but didn't pay attention to people at the table asking for meat.... we found ourselves yelling at the servers to try to get them to finish serving the table ... usually to no avail. I think Via Brazil is a better value with many more choices on the salad bar.... at Via Brazil we found ourselves worrying about getting to full at the Salad bar ... at Texas de Brazil we thought "the bisque would be good if it were hot....." beautiful restaurant though....

NSA9Tzs7cRsoh1lPHq_Yzg.text: This has been my to go place for my birthday celebration for the past two years.   However this year I was disappointed with the food.    Salad bar good however the meats were not seasoned well.   No real taste very bland at one point I thought I would be asking for steak sauce. Our favorite lamb chops very fatty and absolutely no taste   The dessert a Lilikoi mousse was warm which made it hard to eat.    Overall it was a disappointing birthday lunch.   It will be awhile before going back again

XS1e-yK3DKJoXX6rQd4ZGQ.text: So I finally got to try this Brazilian steakhouse! This is my third Brazilian steakhouse. The salad bar has a variety of options(which I loved). I do recommend to not go overboard with the salad bar(even though it's good!). You want to have room for the variety of meats that will be served to you. They give you the options of how well you like your steaks cooked and would bring out some if the meat you want isn't out. Me and my SO wanted to try their rib meat and they brought it out for us. I would go back again.

hLMOnl7UvWS7M1BRe1I5gA.text: I believe this is the priciest of popular Brazilian steakhouse chains in Vegas, but it's worth the quality of food, beverages and customer service. Their market buffet of additional side dishes has a good variety, and is prepared a lot better. I find their cheese selection tastes fresher. The meat they serve... Just drooling just thinking about it all. My husband's favorite is their House Sirloin, and I love me some lamb. NUM NUM NUM NUM NUM. XD Okay, when I talk about good customer service, I don't mean just checking on how your meal is going. That's like up to par. Whenever we go here, the meat servers actually like talking to us, cracking a few jokes here and there about your cooked preferences. The last time we went, my husband appreciated how a few during the lunch hour came back with his preferences as soon as a meat skewer was ready. LOL. It helped getting seated close to the kitchen. As for cocktails, my fave cocktail happens to be their mojitos. Just keep those coming. If anyone has room for dessert, be aware that their cakes are huge slices. Not a big fan of those though 'cause they taste like they're given the least amount of attention, and came straight outta the cooler.  It all adds up though, even if you eat a meal there during lunch. My husband and I spent between $150-$175 for a weekend lunch that includes 2-3 cocktails and gratuity.

XTWeph9OGeV1pAGPLDNIMQ.text: The girls who answer the phones are miserable there. They treat you like crap and have attitude. They obviously think they're over qualified for the job which they have proven over and over that that's not the case.  I spoke with one of your managers and she was a complete bitch. So yeah, speak with them. Maybe she was on her period.

AzlDT3FLFq_tDXyQvnwLdQ.text: Jacson was very attentive. He took care of us from the beginning, explaining how the process worked in detail. He suggested the featured bottle of wine, which we did decline only because it is not sold by the glass. All the meats were flavorful and hot. The cheesecake was a perfect ending to a perfect meal.  My only complaint was my reservation.  I had called in at 4 pm to make a reservation for 6:30. She offered a 5:15 or a 7:45 since they were fully booked in between. We took the 7:45 arriving 3 minutes early to check in to find our name was never put on the reservation list. They did quickly resolve the situation making us only wait 7 minutes.  When all said and done, it's well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

jsxOcxrLB-CEonsNSKxIbQ.text: Had to try Texas de Brazil on this trip to Vegas.  We were able to get a reservation on Easter for dinner.  I know, not your typical Easter fare but boy was it delicious!    The atmosphere was very warm and inviting with dark colors which is typical of a steakhouse with Brazilian music playing adding to the great vibe.  As soon as you walk up to the building the aroma in the area is the heavenly scent of grilled meats.  Yes, the meats are the star of the show but the Feijoada (stew), lobster bisque and array of wonderful selections on the salad bar were amazing.     Our server was a wonderful hostess and familiarized us with the dining experience for the evening.  She also informed us that we would each receive a complimentary dessert which was part of their Easter special.    If you have picky little eaters, you may want to leave them at home.  Our kids are picky and only consumed the meat but they definitely enjoyed the meat.  My daughters favorites were the parmesan crusted pork and filet mignon.  My son enjoyed the flank steak and and filet mignon.    I am truly a lover of Feijoida and really struggle with having an extra serving of it and the Brazilian cheese bread or another slice of meat.    They also served delicious warm candied bananas and garlic mashed potatoes with the meal.    Parking was plentiful and location was great to walk around after dinner looking at all the shops.  It was a great experience and we will definitely return.

Z6_PPUx_F-QeoKZhwM59vQ.text: I've been to multiple Brazilian steakhouses but Texas de Brazil is hands down the best! In all aspects they have exceeded my expectations. The food was top notch, I enjoyed all the meat! They have so many selections and the servers always come with different kinds of level of doneness. I loved the garlic picanha the best. The service was outstanding. Claudio our server was very well spoken, always asking us if we need anything and water and drinks are never left empty. The staff serving the meat are always there. I never had to flag anybody because there's always somebody rounding and asking if you want what they have. I was blown away by their efficiency. Usually in other places you have to flag down someone or get their attention to go to your table.  Texas de Brazil is hands down the best Brazilian steak house I've been and I've been to a lot.  They also gave a free birthday cake with a candle for my cousin and comped us 20% off because I'm a nurse. Definitely coming back!!

GKTSIaKLYrKfYlAAyZ8YSg.text: We took our family here for dinner over the weekend while we were in Las Vegas. It was such a wonderful experience as well as dinner. We all had a great time, food was fresh and delicious. The meat was so flavorful and juicy, it was literally melting in your mouth. I just love it so much. They also had lot of choices on the salad bar plus great deserts. If you love steaks and salads, this is the best place to come and try it out, you won't be regret it.  It's a little bit expensive for dinner but it's totally worth it because it's all you can eat, fresh steaks that server brings straight to your table, you can pick as many choices as you want, from frank steak (it's my faaaaaaaaavorite), filet mignon wrapped in bacon, lamp chops, braised beef ribs, Brazilian sausage...etc. Their Brazilian cheese bread and sweet fried bananas are the bomb. They are soooo good!!! I also love their deserts like carrot cake, Brazilian papaya cream and cheesecake, very yummy!!!  The restaurant is very roomy, great for family or big groups. Customer service is top notch. They are very friendly, fast, attentive, and very professional. I made a reservation on Yelp and we got seated almost immediately when we got there so I really appreciated the online booking. Overall, it was such a fabulous experience and I can't wait to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Texas de Brazil - Las Vegas, NV, United States

96bIm2yFh7lOguR1uIlS6g.text: I won a gift card for Texas de Brazil at our company Christmas party, I wasn't too excited about it but my husband was. I was pleasantly surprised. As someone who isn't a huge meat eater I headed to the salad bar and I loved all the options. Everything I tried was delicious! I especially loved the lobster bisque. My big surprise was at how much I enjoyed the meat, so good! Better than other high end steakhouses we've tried. My husband was in Heaven, and by the end I was so full I thought I might die. LOL   Our waiter, Richie was amazing and we will request his section when we return.

jJ0lY89TOXTLtKfUMkEiIg.text: we were charged an additional $36 for 3 people  for non alcoholic drinks after the restaurant host realized that it was our first time at the restaurant . they should have explained to us those drinks were not included int eh 52$ weekend lunch . the food was good but that was really upsetting scamming new customers . will try Fogo De Chao next time .

4jMy0rbgeBZmqR-omJP6WQ.text: I have had the finest dining experience here time and time again, waiters are so friendly and attentive, food is delicious, as soon as you take a drink they are already refilling your cup. This is the definition of 5 star service.

EphslrPC438o_di9sAnIrQ.text: Our absolute favorite place to take company when they are in town!!! We go for every special occasion

6LLmeR-Wk6j93muN9AbUPQ.text: I love coming here. They are expensive, but you get what you pay for. I've been here multiple times and have never had a bad experience. Even though they may be a little pricey, they do have a VIP card you can purchase to get a discount. The food is always delicious. The staff is always friendly. I live the variety that comes around. I've been to another Brazilian steakhouse that seemed to focus on sending the cheap meats around. This place is always on point.

4aSqcQQ5vvJdPcLWuwfYgA.text: Everything was amazing. All you can eat. Try the platano (banana)! Dinner is worth the price!

L48E9kZThG9P9ZPCCiHuTw.text: This is, by far, my favorite restaurant...who am I kidding, it's my favorite PLACE, restaurant or otherwise!! I can't even tell you how many times I've been here. Usually, in March, they offer a VIP dining card, which is $60 for 12 meals at half off. Although I passed this year, it's still worth the full price.  This is my wife's and my go-to place for special occasions. We had our first date at TdB. The Event Manager, Monique, and one of the GM's helped me plan my extravagant marriage proposal at TdB. And now, my wife and I returned after our wedding a couple weeks ago. They always treat us great, and the food is phenomenal.  I could go on about the food for days, but the experience can be neatly summarized as an all-you-can-eat, gourmet meat buffet that comes to you! Whether you like filet mignon, sirloin, flank, or ribs, ir pork, or lamb, or sausage...TdB is a meat-eater's heaven on Earth. Don't forget the incredible salad bar, the best in town (everything from prosciutto, to sushi, to palm hearts and cous cous, lobster bisque, shrimp...the list goes on). Careful though...don't pull the rookie mistake of filling up on the salad bar...or the delicious cheesy bread balls at the table. Save room for lots of fried bananas with cinnamon and sugar (free at the table), and the dessert options are insanely good too.  Thank you, TdB, for always providing everything I could ever want in a meal!

mEfApRTnvPRqU_QNUmep4A.text: Holy crap. It's so good make sure you come here on an empty stomach. There is sooooo much food and the fried bananas are so amazing.

teZNjy5RVzIDOg_Zx-otxg.text: If you like meat, this is the place to go, but definitely go HUNGRY. From the salad bar to all the meats brought to your table, you will enjoy every bite. The filet is to die for and the Brazilian special meat melts in your mouth.   My wife loved the leg of lamb and lamb chops. And it just keeps coming and coming. Eventually you have to stop, and then they tempt you with devine desserts. Definitely a special occasion place to have a delicious meal with loved ones.

SPlHmc3X3FtQfbaXFAHwxw.text: The food was well cooked and a good collection of meat. However, the waitress was obnoxious and the service was just poor. Had a rough time getting any service and had to wait for long periods to get any attention. It wasn't even busy.

41u56V2jWWr_HKkQ22gAvQ.text: Came here for my friend's birthday dinner and this place did not disappoint. My favorite meat is lamb. Their lamb was super tender and just melted in my mouth. Thinking about it makes me want to go back. I've been to fogo as well, but prefers Texas de Brazil better.

077exKDF1Y_93I9y0lsleA.text: I LOVEEE STEAK AND LOVEEE THIS PLACE ... All you can eat great service !!! I def recommend this restaurant to all my friends and fam.

vPhdOlIUVHdRUOHi6eid2w.text: Been here about 4 times now and the food is great. Sometimes the food is better times which is my only complaint. For my bosses birthday I purchased an E-certificate online and after a week of calling corporate and emailing, I decided to call here and ask for help, but was basically brushed off. Lady said she would take my info and forward to corporate, but was very short and borderline rude.

yZH07wxp94ATsrAHdptPjw.text: Well I came to the bar.  I needed to kill some time. Nubia the bartender is a freaking doll. So sweet. But after being seated everything was great!!! They even wrote happy birthday on my husband's dessert plate!! Will definitely be back!!!

P9pqKb56-BgDbVTANJGP_Q.text: Great selection of items from the salad bar. Service is very attentive. My favorite meat was the flank steak. Juicy and tender. The lobster bisque was also great!  A nice place for a celebration!

CzytKr_LHO1iLcoaCBSgzQ.text: Service is great. Food is even better. Had a margarita, it was alright, too warm for my taste. Other than that will be coming back for sure. Salad bar is amazing as well!

4gPUjnU4DbdT4MXRtpt5ZA.text: We have been to other Brazilian steakhouses so we know what to expect. The salad bar was smaller than others we have been to. would have like a few more visits by the meat servers. For those reasons I give a 3 star grade...the meat we did get to try was good.

In9WH1Pyoz89dfrmW4NvEQ.text: Amazing restaurant. I came here for my holiday  Christmas party & was beyond surprised with how amazing the food was. The best salad bar ever & great quality food. Everything tasted fresh. The selection at the salad bar was exquisite. This is a great restaurant to bring family for a special occasion or for a romantic dinner. Great service & wonderful atmosphere.

91N4LtkW5OSdP-9HkeyDSQ.text: Best restaurant ever! My mind was completely blown! There was a really diverse salad bar with every kind of vegetable you can imagine. The quality of the meats were really great. There was even bacon-covered chicken! The waiters and waitresses were really fancy too. Definitely worth it if you're willing to go!

QcMCqDW1y0_oj_ibNJG4mA.text: My partner is Brasilian, and even he agreed this place was great. Lots of variety at the salad bar, and l the rodizio was wonderful. Caipirinhas were mixed--passion fruit got a better review than the lime   Caramel cheesecake.was delish, & espresso killed it.   Service was truly amazing.

F6hj2GWApeOK9csWdiY7bQ.text: Super awesome service and AYCE Top shelf cuts of meat

OrewtZM58A6FXbtQlcbD4w.text: Best Service hands down! The waiters and waitresses here are by far the best I've ever encountered! Even if I took a sip out of my cup someone would come literally a minute or less later to refill it. I've been here before and I love how there service is still consistent. The food is beyond amazing and I tried everything and LOVED everything. The bathrooms were super clean the whole place was very clean. Ambience of this restaurant is so relaxing. 5/5 can't go wrong going to this place ever !

rkukqCDrEEVnbXNPWHmyUA.text: The price for all you can eat is really good.  The service is always great.  Sometimes the meat is really salty.  The beef ribs are the best.

a8oPh5K_eQRP0AvBbvB1lQ.text: First time here and we loved it!  We had to wait 20 minutes to be seated even if we had reservation. The salad-bar was awesome, it had so many choices of salads and meets and cheeses. The meats kept coming and coming and they were all delicious, a little salty for me, but delicious! They brought mashed potatoes and the fried banana, both very good, I do wish the was a hot vegetable option also. The Banana Foster cake was very good, I feel that for the price you pay per person dessert should have been included! Rachel S our server was very polite, knowledgeble and efficient.

AuAQ4Q1YKicsRXxQtmmxbQ.text: Be ready to EAT when visiting Texas De Brazil. Salad bar and endless amounts of meats being served to you nonstop. Love the mini cheese breads and fried plantains they give you. Making me hungry as I type this review.

usdh6pwJrb1GKU6_tqb3lQ.text: Food: 9/10 Service: 10/10 Price: 7/10 Atmosphere: 8/10  Texas de Brazil is simply amazing. It is a Brazilian Steakhouse  meaning that you have about 7-10 selections of meat to pick from in various styles (rare-well-done). The meat is carried on skewers and hand cut from the skewer right to your plate.   The food is awesome. The selections include beef, lamb, chicken and pork. There are also additional items that get added on every few months. But lets be honest you are really going for the steak, which is perfect because you literally have every part of the cow to choose from. I would recommend the garlic sirloin, flank steak, and of course the top sirloin. If you don't like meat don't worry, there is also a salad bar with options ranging from salad to soup to sushi. I usually don't deal with that area too much (gotta save room for the meat lol) but I've only heard good things.  The waiters/ waitresses are awesome and take really good care of you while you're there, providing excellent suggestions as well as giving you information about the whole experience. (RACHEL IS THE BEST!!) The gauchos are super nice and will even ask if you have any special requests once they see that your aren't selecting the meats that have come by. If you say yes, you are the first to receive the meat and it is cooked in whichever style you prefer.   Finally, the biggest knock on Texas de Brazil is the price. Yes, it is $50 per person but you do get unlimited meat and unlimited salad bar access for as long as you wish so it really pays for itself. The experience, food, and service are well worth it and you definitely wouldn't regret spending a family/date night at Texas de Brazil

LOlLyNLYVvJ1TCEE5WSQKw.text: Come with an empty stomach for the endless meat parade and amazing salad bar.  It's delicious!

vvXddpSMReh21U4EuMITnQ.text: The quality of the meat was beyond excellent!! The service stayed consistent and was above expectation!! The flavor of the meat really came thru. There are a million dessert options!! I love this place

0rFcmsPIOmAM-L0EXQcM7A.text: We have ate here several times for special occasions. Today we were a party of 18 family members. Our server "Roberto" was patient and professional. We had a great time.

vRehYHPuZTudjYhU6ggwBg.text: Delicious, great service.   4 stars because the wait for a table took over 15 minutes even with a reservation.

Ft4bq4crxXEt_mM2c5JHfQ.text: I wish it was an option for no stars.  The absolute worst experience I've ever had. Management doesn't care that your not happy with service. I was forced to pay 80 dollars for 2 pieces of meat. I was by passed continuously by waiters and did not receive quality service, compared to the tables of white diners sitting behind me. In the severs defense some people in my party had already closed out, but they are suppose to check for the green flip cards. I was served 2 pieces of meat in 2 hrs. I was offered the same meat four times.  I came with intentions of eating a full meal, and left hungry after spending 2hrs at this restaurant . Worst experience of my life. Spoke with every member of management to try and rectify the situation. Not even an apology, but instead they informed me that they couldn't tell how many pieces of meat I ate. Petty management and petty practices. Was treated like a run a way slave and called a liar. No respect or fucks were given and no reasonable solutions were offered. Once Told management the truth about how I felt and nothing was done. I was a man of my word, the check was 67.00,  I paid 80 dollars only because I was being forced to stay inside the restaurant  and I didn't want problems. I told the manager to his face that I no longer wanted to be in the restaurant after receiving such horrible service.  They wanted me to stay longer and finish my meal, but why would I when the service was already horrible.  Forgot to mention the 40 min wait for the mixed drink we ordered as soon as we got to the table. We will be contacting the corporate office on Monday morning.

ssaDNYCuLbTJBwM5HFCQ6g.text: One of the best restaurants to dine when having a craving for meat, especially since you get to choose and taste an array of different meats ranging from beef, chicken, lamb, pork, and sausage.  There's something for everyone, even the pickiest water as they also have a salad bar, soup, variety of cheeses and charcuterie. I love the chimichurri sauce and sauteed mushrooms.  I'm not a key lime pie kind of gal but my spouse ordered it and it was delish! Our server was friendly and patient with our restless infant - yes, I bring my infant to dinner because a girls gotta eat and I LOVE to eat!
